Op. 338; ὄφρʼ ἡμῖν ἑκάεργον ἱλάσσεαι Il. 1.147; c. part., ἱλάσκομαι πέμπων by presenting, Pi. O. 7.9; τοῦτον (sc. θεὸν) ἱλάσκου ποῶν μηδὲν ἄτοπον Men. Epit. 558; of the dead as heroized, θυσίῃσί τινα ἱ. Hdt. 5.47.
conciliate, ἱ. τινὰ χρήμασι Id. 8.112; πῶς ἱλασόμεθα καὶ τίνι λόγῳ; Pl. Phd. l.c.; ἱ. τὴν ὀργήν τινος Plu. Cat.Mi. 61.
expiate, τὰς ἁμαρτίας Ep.Hebr. 2.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. with fut. ἱλάσομαι, also ἱλασθής ομαι v.l. in LXX 4 Ki. 5.18: aor. 1 ἱλάσθην ib. Ex. 32.14, al.:— to be merciful, gracious, τινι ll.cc.; ἱλάσθητί μοι τῷ ἁμαρτωλῷ Ev.Luc. 18.13; ταῖς ἁμαρτίαις τινῶν LXX Ps. 77(78).38: c. inf., ἱλάσθη κύριος περιποιῆσαι τὸν λαόν ib. Ex. 32.14.
propitiation, Orac. ap. Phleg. Macr. 4.
a means of appeasing, in pl., Plu. Sol. 12, Orph. A. 39, 554, etc.
atonement, sin offering, LXX Ez. 44.27, 2 Ma. 3.33, 1 Ep.Jo. 2.2, 4.10, Ph. 1.121.

definition: ἱλαστήριος, α, ον ( ος, ον PFay. 337 (ii A.D.)),

children.definition: propitiatory, offered in propitiation, μνῆμα J. AJ 16.7.1; θάνατος LXX 4 Ma. 17.22; θυσίαι PFay. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱλαστήριον ἐπίθεμα, the mercy-seat, covering of the ark in the Holy of Holies, LXX Ex. 25.16(17): ἱλαστήριον alone as Subst., ib. Le. 16.2, al., Ep.Hebr. 9.5, cf. Ph. 2.150.
ἀνάθημα) propitiatory gift or offering, Ep.Rom. 3.25; of a monument, Inscr.Cos 81,347.
monastery, Men.Prot. p.15 D.
propitiator, Aq., Thd. Ps. 85(86).5, f.l. in LXX 1 Es. 8.53.
LXX Da. 9.18.
expiatory or propitiatory offering, Chron.Lind. B. 49.

definition: ἰλεας, τάς, dub. sens. in Abh.Berl.Akad. 1928(6).16 ( Cos): perh. Coan for τὰς ἴλας ( ἴλη) or τὰς ἱλέας ( ἵλεως).

children.definition: ἰλεός [ ῑ], ὁ, = εἰλεός Ι and ΙΙ, Hsch. ἵλεος, = ἵλαος; and ἵλεως, ων, Att. for ἵλαος (q.v.).
propitiation, Plu. in Hes. 26.

definition: ἴλη [ῑ], Dor. ἴλᾱ ( Boeot. ϝιλ- in ϝιλαρχίω), ἡ,

children.definition: band, troop of men, Hdt. 1.73, 202; εὔφρονες ἶλαι merry companies, Pi. N. 5.38; also ἴλα λεόντων E. Alc. 581 (lyr.).

troop of horse, prop. of sixty-four men, cf. Arr. Tact. 18.2; but varying in number, Ascl. Tact. 7.2;= Lat. turma, Plb. 6.25.1, al., D.H. 6.12, al., Plu. Caes. 45, al.; later, = Lat. ala, IGRom. 3.272 ( Galatia), BGU 69 (ii A.D.), J. AJ 17.10.9, etc.; κατὰ ἴλας,= ἰλαδόν, opp. κατὰ τάξεις, X. An. 1.2.16: generally, troop or company of soldiers, S. Aj. 1407 (anap.).
ἀγέλα (q.v.), X. Lac. 2.11; κατʼ ἴλην Plu. Lyc. 16.

to be gracious, of a god, once in Hom. in subj., εἴ κεν Ἀπόλλων ἡμῖν ἱλήκῃσι Od. 21.365; elsewh. in opt., ἱλήκοι Ἀπόλλων h.Ap. 165; ἱλήκοις, Δέσποινα AP 5.72 ( Rufin.); ἱλήκοις, Πολιοῦχε ib. 9.154 ( Agath.); θεοὶ μάκαρες, ἱλήκοιτε Alciphr. 3.68, cf. Hld. 8.11, 9.25. (Prob. εἱλ-, cf. sq. [ἵλημι])

definition: ἵλημι [ῑ], = foreg., only in imper. ἵληθι, in prayers,

children.definition: be gracious! Od. 3.380, 16.184, h.Hom. 20.8, etc.: Aeol. ἔλλᾱθι (q. v.): Dor. ἵλᾰθι Theoc. 15.143, Luc. Epigr. 22; both together, ἵλᾰθʼ, ἄναξ, ἵληθι AP 12.158 ( Mel.): pl., ἵλᾰτε A.R. 4.984, Man. 6.754. (Prob. pf. imper. fr. se-sl-; Aeol. ἔλλ- points to εἵλ- as the true Ion. spelling; Dor. pf. part. dat. ἱλαότι (leg. εἱλ-) Hsch.: ῑ is genuine in ἵλεως, ἱλάσκομαι [fr. si-sl-].)

definition: ἴληοι θηρία διὰ φρυγάνων, κτλ., Hsch. (fort. θηρίδια φ.; cf. εἰλύϊος, ἐλειός III).
ἰλῆς [ῑ], Ion. contr. fr. ἰλήεις,= ἱλάεις (q. v.), prob. for εἰλῆς (q.v.).

children.definition: descendants of Ilos, i.e. Trojans, Sapph. 44.13 L.-P., AP 9.77 ( Antip. Thess.): as Adj., Ἰ. βασιλῆες E. Andr. 1023 (lyr.).
Ilian, Trojan, μῦθοι AP 9.192 ( Antiphil.); πόλεμος Str. 1.2.9; concerning the Iliad, προσῳδία, title of work by Hdn. Gr.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἰλιακά, τά, word of doubtful meaning in PTeb. 61 ( b). 319, cf. 68.88, al. (ii B.C.).
Ἰλιακός, χώρη Hdt. 5.94, cf. A. Ag. 453 (lyr.), E. Hec. 102 (anap.), 923 (lyr.), etc.; epith. of Athena, Hdt. 7.43, IG 9(1).350 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst.,
γῆ) Troy, the Troad, Hdt. 5.122.
γυνή) a Trojan woman, E. Hel. 1114 (lyr.), Tr. 245 (lyr.), etc.
ποίησις) the Iliad of Homer, Hdt. 2.116, Arist. Po. 1448b38, al.: prov., κακῶν Ἰλιάς, i.e. an endless string of woes, D. 19.148, D.S. 36.6, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: thrush, perh. the redwing, Turdus iliacus, Arist. HA 617a21 (s.v.l.); cf. ἰλλάς III.

become dizzy, lose oneʼs head, as when one looks down from a height, ἰλιγγιῶν ἀφʼ ὑψηλοῦ κρεμασθείς Pl. Tht. 175d; from drunkenness, ψυχὴ ἰ. ὥσπερ μεθύουσα Id. Phd. 79c; ἰ. κάρα λίθῳ πεπληγμένος Ar. Ach. 1218; ἰ. καὶ χασμᾶσθαι Phld. Rh. 2.176S.; from perplexity, ἐσκοτώθην καὶ ἰλιγγίασα Pl. Prt. 339e; ἰ. ὑπὸ τῆς τοῦ λόγου ἀπορίας Id. Ly. 216c; ὑπὸ τοῦ δέους Ar. Ach. 581; ἐπί τινι Luc. Tox. 30; πρὸς τὴν θέαν Hld. 5.6:—also written εἰλιγγιάω, freq. in codd. of Pl., cf. AP 7.706 ( Diog.), Plu. Alex. 74; ἰλ- Phld. l.c.; εἰλιγγιάω but ἴλιγγος acc. to Sch. Ar. Ach. 581, Suid. s.v. εἰλιγγιῶ.

data.quote: ἰ. ὑπὸ τῆς τοῦ λόγου ἀπορίας

children.definition: spinning round; esp. swimming in the head, Hp. Aph. 3.17 (pl.), Pl. R. 407c (pl.); σκοτοδινίαν ἴλιγγόν τε ἐμποιεῖν τινι Id. Lg. 892e; also, disturbance of the bowels, Nic. Al. 597.
eddies or wreaths of smoke, A.R. 4.142.
whirlpool, Procop. Goth. 4.6.
agitation of mind, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1068c:—also written εἴλιγγος, A.R. l.c., Nic. l.c., Plu. Caes. 60, and codd. Pl.
verticulosus, Gloss.
whirling, whirlpool, D.S. 17.97, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.71.
Gal. UP 7.13. (Written ἴλιξ in Hsch.:— also ἰλίγγη, ἡ, Id.)

definition: ἴλιον τὸ τῆς γυναικὸς ἐφήβαιον δηλοῖ, καὶ κόσμον γυναικεῖον παρὰ Κῴοις, Hsch.

children.definition: faring to Ilium, Tim. Pers. 132.

Ilium, the city of Ilus, Troy, Il. 5.210, al., Alc. Supp. 8.4, E. Andr. 103 (eleg.): Ἴλιον, τό, Hom. only in Il. 15.71, but always in Trag. (exc. E. l.c.):—hence Ep. genitives, Ἰλιόθεν, from Troy, Il. 14.251, Od. 9.39; Ἰλιόθι πρό before Troy, 8.581, etc.; Ἰλιόφι κλυτὰ τείχεα the walls of Troy, Il. 21.295.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., Ἴλιος, α, ον, Ilian, Trojan, Ἀθάνα E. Hec. 1008: -ος, ον is f.l. in Id. Hel. 1164 (lyr.).
volumen, Gloss. (dub.); ἰλις sine expl., Hsch.; cf. ἰλλίς.

the Ilissus, in Attica, Pl. Criti. 112a, Hdn.Gr. 1.213, etc.: Ἱλισός, the god I., IG 1(2).324.89, cf. 310.206: Ἰλισσός freq. f.l. in codd., as Hdt. 7.189, Str. 9.1.24, A.R. 1.215, D.P. 424: Εἰλισσός f.l. in Paus. 1.19.5.
bind up, make into a bundle, Hsch. ἴλλαι· συστροφαί, Id.
look awry, squint, Hp. Epid. 3.1.γʹ; of the eyes, to be distorted, Id. Coac. 214, Epid. 4.12:—so also in Pass., ἰλλαίνομαι, Id. Morb. 3.12. ἴλλαος, v. ἵλαος.
rope, band, βοῦς, τόν τʼ οὔρεσι βουκόλοι ἄνδρες ἰλλάσιν . . δήσαντες ἄγουσιν Il. 13.572.

data.quote: βοῦς, τόν τʼ οὔρεσι βουκόλοι ἄνδρες ἰλλάσιν . . δήσαντες ἄγουσιν

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., close-packed, herding together, of cattle, ἰλλάδες γοναί S. Fr. 70, E. Fr. 837.
look askance, leer, glossed by διανεύω, Suid.

definition: ἰλλίς, ίδος, ἡ, fem. of sq., Hsch.

children.definition: squinting (acc. to Moer., Att. for στραβός) , ἰ. γεγενῆσθαι to get a squint, Ar. Th. 846: Comp. ἰλλότερος Sophr. 158, cf. Gal. 17(1).680.
Poll. 2.54.

definition: ἴλλοψ, οπος, ὁ, ἡ, coined as etym. of ἔλλοψ, Ath. 7.308b, c, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.728e.
Ἰλλυριοί, οἱ, Illyrians, Hdt. 1.196, etc. ( Ἱλλ- IG 1(2).329.24): Ἰλλυρία, ἡ,

children.definition: Illyria, St.Byz.:—also Ἰλλυρίς, ἡ, Ptol. Geog. 2.16.1, App. Ill. 6; γονή S. Fr. 601:— Adj. Ἰλλυρικός, ή, όν, Illyrian: -κή, (sc. ἱστορία), ἡ, title of work by Appian: -κόν, τό, the region or province of Illyria, Ep.Rom. 15.19: Ἰλλυρίζω, speak the Illyrian language, St. Byz. s.v. Ἰλλυρία:—hence Adv. Ἰλλυριστί, ibid.
aor. 1 Med. ἰλλάμην, plait, πλοκάμους IG 5(2).472.11 ( Megalopolis, ii/iii A.D.).
squinting, distorted, ὄμματα Hp. Mul. 1.41.
squint, both in Sch. Ar. Eq. 292, cf. Suid.:

definition: ἰλλώπτω, Com.Adesp. 1019, Adam. 1.23, Hsch. (For the termination cf. γοργώψατο.)

children.definition: distortion, ὀφθαλμῶν Hp. Prorrh. 1.69, cf. Aret. SD 1.7.

definition: ἴλμη δεσμός, σειρά, Theognost. Can. 15 ( ἰλμηδεσμός cod.).

children.definition: destroyer of Ilus, i.e. of Troy, prob. in Dosiad. Ara 17.
distress, Schwyzer 686.2 ( Pamphylia, iv B.C.).
sediment deposited in water, Gal. 13.45 (sed leg. λύματα).
muddy, ποταμός A.R. 2.823; ζάλος Nic. Th. 568: metaph., ἀχλὺς ἰ., of the soulʼs material envelope, App.Anth. 3.146 (Theon).
εἰλυός, den, lair, Call. Jov. 25.
mud, slime, τεύχεα . . κείσεθʼ ὑπʼ ἰλύος κεκαλυμμένα Il. 21.318, cf. IG 1(2).94.20, 23, Zeno Stoic. 1.29, Inscr.Délos 354.19, etc.; of alluvial soil, Hdt. 2.7; ἰ. καὶ ψάμμος Hp. Aër. 9.
dregs, sediment, Id. Mul. 1.66; of wine, Arist. GA 753a24, al.

impurity, αἵματος Gal. 1.603, cf. 616; στέρνων Androm. ap. eund. 14.35. [ ἰλῡς -ῡν Choerob. in Theod. 1.331; gen. ἰλῠος APl. 16.230 ( Leon.), A.R. 1.10, but ἰλῡος (metri gr. Hdn.Gr. 2.117) Il. l.c.] (Cf. Russ. il, Polish ił ‘mud’, ‘potterʼs clay’.)
crawl, like a worm, Hp. Genit. 5, Pl. Ti. 92a, Meno Iatr. 37.32, J. AJ 1.1.4, BJ 3.7.21, Plu. Vind. 2.567b, Max.Tyr. 26.6, Ael. NA 8.14, 9.32. ( εἰλυσπ- Meno l.c., v.l. in Pl. l.c.)
crawling, Arist. IA 709a28.
of or for crawling, Arist. HA 487b21.
cover with slime or dirt, Hsch.
muddy, slimy, Hp. Coac. 512, Max.Tyr. 41.3, S.E. M. 5.75; ὕδωρ Str. 4.1.6; πηλός Arr. Ind. 41.3; περίττωμα Gal. 1.616; τὸ -ῶδες Plu. Fac.lun. 2.935a.

definition: ἰμ- in compds., = ἰν, Arc., Cypr., Cret. for ἐν.

children.definition: of or for drawing water, ἱμαῖον (sc. μέλος) song of the draw-well, Call. Hec. Fr. 260.66 Pf. [updated ref.], cf. Trypho ap. Ath. 14.618d.

definition: ἱμαλίς, ίδος, ἡ, Syrac. epith. of Demeter, Polem.Hist. 39:—hence ἱμαλιά, ἡ, = τὸ ἐπίμετρον τῶν ἀλεύρων, Hsch.: ἱμάλιος, α, ον,

children.definition: abundant, Id.: as name of a month at Hierapytna, GDI 5040.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dor. word for ὁ νόστος καὶ τὰ ἐπίμετρα τῶν ἀλεύρων Trypho ap. Ath. 14.618d;= ἐπιμύλιος ᾠδή, Hsch., Poll. 4.53.

data.quote: ὁ νόστος καὶ τὰ ἐπίμετρα τῶν ἀλεύρων

definition: ἱμαντάριον [ ῐ], τό, Dim. of ἱμάς, BCH 29.536 ( Delos, ii B.C.), POxy. 326 (i A.D.).

children.definition: halyard, Hsch.
pricking the tape, ‘fast and loose’, a trick practised at fairs, etc., Poll. 9.118, Eust. 979.28.
pricker of tapes (cf. foreg.): metaph., ‘thimble-rigger’, of sophists, Democr. 150.
corrigiae, Gloss.

definition: ἱμαντίδιον, τό, Dim. of ἱμάς, EM 671.8.

children.definition: of leathern thongs, Hdt. 4.189, Hp. Art. 78.
Dim. of ἱμάς, strap, Hp. Mochl. 41.

children.label: II
children.definition: Aret. SA 1.8.

definition: ἱμαντίσκος, ὁ, Dim. of ἱμάς, Herod. 6.71.

children.definition: insertion of bonding courses, PTeb. 402.32 (ii A.D.).
leathern band, Hsch. s.v. ζεύγλας.
bound with thongs, gloss on τρητοῖσι, Sch. Od. 1.440.
fighting with the caestus, Orac. in Tz. H. 7.422.
purveyor of straps, etc., for the races, CIG 2758 D 6 ( Aphrodisias).
leathern noose, of a polypus’ leg, AP 9.94 ( Isid. Aeg.).
spindle-shanked; esp.,
Plin. HN 5.46, Apollod. ap. Tz. H. 7.767.
water-bird, Dionys. Av. 2.9.
cut straps, Poll. 7.81, 83.
furnish with straps, in Pass., Hsch. s.v. πυξ<ίνην>.
fibrous, of the hair, Pl. Ti. 76c; φλοιός, κλῶνες, Dsc. 1.84, 3.15; of asbestos, Id. 5.138.
ropy, Gal. 1.615; of the uvula when diseased, Id. 10.988.

children.label: II
children.definition: sinewy, wiry, of athletes, Philostr. Gym. 37.
hawser, Hsch. s.v. σίρα.
binding with thongs, Hsch.; of the straps of a car, Poll. 1.142.

children.label: II
children.definition: piece of timber used instead of a bond-stone, LXX Si. 22.16, Phot., etc.
one who sings the ἱμαῖον μέλος, Poll. 4.53, Hsch. ( ἰλ- cod.).

definition: ἱμάς, ὁ, gen. ἱμάντος (not ἱμᾶς, ἱμᾶντος Hdn.Gr. 2.939): Ep. dat. pl. ἱμάντεσσι:—

children.definition: leathern strap or thong, Il. 10.262, etc.; ἱμάντα βοός 3.375; βοέους ἱμάντας 22.397: mostly in pl., in various senses:

children.label: b
children.definition: reins, 23.324, etc.; τμητοῖς ἱμᾶσι S. El. 747, cf. E. Hipp. 1222.

children.label: c
children.definition: straps on which the body of the chariot was hung, Il. 5.727.

children.label: d

children.label: e
children.definition: boxing-glove, consisting of several straps put round the hand, ib. 684, Pi. N. 6.35, Pl. Prt. 342c; ἱ. πυκτικοί Eup. 22 D.
girdle of Aphrodite, Il. 14.214, 219.

children.label: b
children.definition: chin-strap of the helmet, 3.371.

children.label: c
children.definition: thong, by which the bolt was shot home into the socket, Od. 1.442, cf. 4.802, 21.46.

children.label: d
children.definition: Hom., thong or latchet of a sandal, X. An. 4.5.14, Ephipp. 14.9, Men. 109.2, Ev.Marc. 1.7.

children.label: e
children.definition: rail-rope, Aristag. 5.

children.label: f
children.definition: well-rope, Poll. 10.31, Moer.

children.label: g
children.definition: dog-leash, X. Cyn. 7.6: prov., ἦσθʼ ἱμὰς κύνειος you were tough as a dog- leash, Ar. V. 231; also σὺν τῷ κυνὶ καὶ τὸν ἱμάντα Phot.

data.quote: σὺν τῷ κυνὶ καὶ τὸν ἱμάντα

children.label: h
children.definition: whip, scourge, ἔξω τις δότω ἱμάντα Antiph. 74.8, cf. Men. Sam. 106; ἡ διὰ τῶν ἱ. αἰκεία POxy. 1186.2 (iv A.D.), cf. Act.Ap. 22.25; ἱμάντες παιδαγωγῶν Lib. Ep. 911.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: diseased condition of the uvula, Id. 17(1).379.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἱμάντες, in Archit., planks laid on rafters, IG 1(2).372.82, 373.236, al., 2(2).1668.55, 1672.305; on στρωτῆρες (q.v.), ib. 463.66. (Cf. Skt. sināti ‘bind’, Lat. saeta.) [ ⏑_, usually; but also ῑ in Ep., Il. 8.544, etc.: in derivs. and compds. always ῐ.]
thong of a whip, whip, Il. 23.582, Od. 13.82, Eranos 13.88 (pl.): metaph., νηὸς ἱ., i.e. shipʼs rudder, AP 6.28 ( Jul.); later, any thong, Opp. C. 4.217.
flog or imprison ( ἱμάς), Schwyzer 409 ( Elis).
scaffolding (cf. ἱμάς), or = αἱμασιά, IG 4.823.26 ( Troezen).

definition: ἱμάσσω [ῐ], fut. ἱμάσω [ᾰ]: aor. ἵμᾰσα: ( ἱμάς):—

children.definition: flog horses, τοὺς ἵμασʼ Ἀντίλοχος Il. 5.589, cf. 11.531; of men, εἰ . . σε πληγῇσιν ἱμάσσω 15.17, cf. Hes. Th. 857; ἵμασε χθόνα χειρί smote it, h.Ap. 340; ὅτε . . γαῖαν ἱμάσσῃ when he smites it with lightnings, Il. 2.782:— Pass., ἱμασσόμενος δέμας αὔραις AP 7.696 ( Arch.), cf. Nonn. D. 42.491.
to be a clothier, IGRom. 4.1209 ( Thyatira) (nisi leg. πραγματ-).
loaded with apparel, ναῦς Thphr. Lap. 68.

definition: ἱματιδάριον, τό, Dim. of ἱμάτιον, Ar. Fr. 90.

children.definition: Dim. of ἱμάτιον, Ar. Pl. 985, Lys. Fr. 316S., BGU 1103.12 (i B.C.); by crasis with the Art., θαἰματίδια Ar. Lys. 401.
furnish with clothing, UPZ 2.14 (ii B.C.), etc.:— Pass., τοῦ παιδὸς τρεφομένου καὶ -ομένου POxy. 275.14 (i A.D.); γυνὴ ἱματισμένη ἔχιδνα Secund. Sent. 8; ἱματισμένος Ev.Marc. 5.15.
wardrobe, IG 2(2).1672.229, 309, Hsch. s.v. κανδυτάναι.
clothes-seller, Luc. Merc.Cond. 38, Pseudol. 21.
clothes-stealer, D.L. 6.52.
one who lets out actorʼs costumes, IG 12(9).207.22 ( Eretria, iii B.C.), SIG 424.85 ( Delph., iii B.C.), Poll. 7.78, AB 100.

definition: ἱμάτιον [ ῑμᾰ-], τό, in form a Dim. of ἷμα (i.e. εἷμα),

children.definition: a piece of dress; in usage always of an outer garment, formed by an oblong piece of cloth worn above the χιτών, Ar. Ec. 333, IG 2(2).1524.205, al., D. 24.114, etc.; λαμπρὸν ἱ. ἔχων Epich. [277]; θοἰμάτιον by crasis for τὸ ἱμ-, Ar. Nu. 179, al.; θοἰμάτιον καθεὶς ἄχρι τῶν σφυρῶν D. 19.314; ἱματίων ἕλξεις Pl. Alc. 1.122c; of the Roman toga, Plu. Brut. 17, Cor. 14: hence ἐν ἱματίοις, of civilians, = togati, Id. Cam. 10; but ἱ. Ἑλληνικόν, opp. the toga, Luc. Merc.Cond. 25.

ἱμάτια, τά, generally, clothes, Hdt. 1.9, Pl. Plt. 279e, D. 27.10; by crasis, θαἰμάτια Hippon. 83.1, Ar. V. 408 (lyr.), Lys. 1093; of grave-clothes, ἐν εἱμ. τρισὶ [θάπτειν] IG 12(5).593.2 (Iulis, v/iv BC), cf. Plu. Sol. 21.
ἱμάτια πόλεως τείχη Eust. 1871.50.

children.label: II
children.definition: cloth, Hdt. 4.23, D.S. 14.109, Ael. VH 8.7, Iamb. VP 21.100. [ ἱμ- in Att. Inscrr., IG 1(2).427, 386.18, 2(2).1514.16, etc.; εἱμ- ib. 12(5) l.c. ( εμ- lap.), 5(1).1390.16, al.( Andania, i B.C.), which is easier to explain, v. εἷμα, εἱματισμός.]
collector of deliveries in kind in the form of clothing, BGU 1564.1 (ii A.D.).

definition: ἱματιοπλύτης [ ῠ], ου, ὁ, = κναφεύς, dub. in BGU 118 iii 7 (ii A.D.).

children.definition: clothes-making, Gloss.

definition: ἱματιοπράτης [ ᾱ], ου, ὁ, = sq., Stud.Pal. 22.95.2 (iii A.D.).

children.definition: clothes-dealer, Critias Fr. 64D., UPZ 8.32 (ii B.C.), AJP 38.418 ( Egypt), Ephes. 3p.146 ( εἱμ-), Ptol. Tetr. 179:—also in form εἱματοπ., Gloss.:—fem. ἱμᾰτιό-πωλις, ιδος, IG 2.3650, Ath. 3.76a; ἡ ἱ. ἀγορά Poll. 7.78:
tax on clothes-dealers, PLeipz. 5.7 ( Ber.Sächs.Ges.d.W. 37.245 (iii A.D.)).
skilled in making clothes: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the tailorʼs art, Pl. Plt. 280a, Gal. Thras. 26.
portmanteau, POxy. 116.10 (ii A.D.), Ammon. Diff. p.135 V.(cf. Ptol.Ascal. p.406H.), Ael.Dion. Fr. 206.
take care of clothes, Luc. Hipp. 8.
wardrobe, Gloss.:—also in form εἱματοφ-, ib.
keeper of the wardrobe, LXX 4 Ki. 22.14:—in form εἱματο-, Gloss.

clothing, apparel, Thphr. Char. 23.8, Aen.Tact. 31.15, SIG 1015.35 ( Halic., iii B.C.), PHib. 1.54 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. 28.1 (iii B.C.), BCH 6.24 ( Delos, ii B.C.), Plb. 11.9.2, Ev.Luc. 7.25, Plu. Alex. 39: εἱμ- PEleph. 1.4 (iv B.C.), IG 5(1).1390.15 ( Andania, i B.C.), etc.

draw up, esp. water from a well, Ath. 8.352a; κάδῳ Orib. Eup. 1.1.2:— Pass., to be tapped of, yield, γάλα Arist. HA 522b12, PA 688b10. (From ἱμάς 2f, acc. to Ael.Dion. Fr. 211; ἱμάω has ῑ (v. καθιμάω), like ἱμονιά, ἱμανήθρη, but ἱμαῖος has ῐ.)

definition: ϝιμβάναι ( γιμβ- cod.) · ζεύγανα, Hsch. ἴμβηρις,

children.definition: Id. (cf. Lith. ungurỹs ‘eelʼ).

definition: Ἴμβρος, ἡ, the island of Imbros, Il. 13.33, etc.: also, epith. of Pelasgian Hermes, St.Byz. s.v.: hence Ἴμβριοι, οἱ,

children.definition: the Imbrians, IG 1(2).198.101.

definition: ἱμείρω [ῑ], Aeol. ἰμέρρω Sapph. 1.27, Alc. Supp. 26.5, cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.949: ( ἵμερος):—

children.definition: long for, desire, c. gen., τί κακῶν ἱμείρετε τούτων . . ; Od. 10.431, cf. 555, Hes. Sc. 31; μεγάλων B. 1.62; μάχης A. Ag. 940; βίου S. Fr. 952, cf. Ar. Nu. 435: c. inf., long or wish to do, Alc. l.c., Sol. 13.7, A. Pers. 233, S. OT 587, Ichn. 128; ὄσσα μοι τέλεσσαι θῦμος ἰμέρρει Sapph. l.c.: c. Adj. neut., γνωτὰ κοὐκ ἄγνωτά μοι προσήλθεθʼ ἱμείροντες S. OT 59: abs., Id. El. 1053; ἀσμένοις . . καὶ ἱμείρουσιν . . τὸ φῶς ἐγίγνετο Pl. Cra. 418d.

data.quote: γνωτὰ κοὐκ ἄγνωτά μοι προσήλθεθʼ ἱμείροντες
ἀσμένοις . . καὶ ἱμείρουσιν . . τὸ φῶς ἐγίγνετο

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. ἱμείρομαι, aor. 1 ἱμειράμην Il. 14.163:— Pass., aor. 1 ἱμέρθην Hdt. 7.44: c. gen., ὁππότʼ ἂν ἡβήσῃ τε καὶ ἧς ἱμείρεται αἴης ( Ep. aor. subj.) Od. 1.41; χρημάτων ἱ. μεγάλως Hdt. 3.123: c. inf., εἴ πως ἱμείραιτο παραδραθέειν φιλότητι (cf. ἵμερος) Il. 14.163, cf. Od. 1.59, Hdt. 6.120, S. OT 386.— Ep., Ion. ( Hdt. and Hp. Morb. 4.39), and Trag. word: never in Att. Prose; introduced as etym. in Pl. Cra. l.c.

definition: ἴμεν, ἴμεναι [ῐ], Ep. inf. of εἶμι ( ibo).
ἱμέρα, ἡ, old collat. form of ἡμέρα, acc. to Pl. Cra. 418c, 418d.

children.definition: with lovely diadem, θεά B. 16.9.
with lovely limbs, B. 12.137.

exciting desire, lovely, charming, in Hom. always of things, ἱμερόεντα . . ἔργα γάμοιο Il. 5.429, etc.; χροὸς ἱμερόεντος 14.170; ἀοιδή, ἔπεα, Od. 1.421, 17.519; γόος (cf. ἵμερος) 10.398; Χαρίτων χορὸν ἱμερόεντα 18.194, cf. Il. 18.603; ἱμερόεν κιθάριζε ib. 570; so later κισσός D.P. 947; ἔρωτες AP 5.277 ( Agath.); of persons, Pi. Fr. 87 ( Sup.), Thgn. 1365 ( Sup.), Theoc. 7.118; νύμφη Coluth. 295.
sweetly blooming, ἔαρ AP 9.564 (Nicias): vulg. ἡμεροθ-.
lovely of soul, Orph. H. 56.8.
have sexual intercourse with, τοῦ ἀνδρός, or abs., Hp. Mul. 1.12, 24.
breathing sweetness, BMus. Inscr. 1084.

longing, yearning after, c. gen. rei, σίτου . . περὶ φρένας ἵμερος αἱρεῖ Il. 11.89, etc.; γόου ἵμερον ὦρσε raised [in them] a yearning after tears, i.e. a desire of the soul to disburden itself in grief, 23.14; ὑφʼ ἵμερος ὦρτο γόοιο Od. 16.215, etc.: with gen. obj. added, πατρὸς ὑφʼ ἵμερον ὦρσε γόοιο for his father, 4.113; ἵμερον ἔχειν, = ἱμείρεσθαι, c. inf., Hdt. 5.106, 7.43; ἵμερος ἔχει με . . ἰδεῖν S. OC 1725 (lyr.), cf. Sapph. Supp. 24.11; ἵ. ἐπείρεσθαί μοι ἐπῆλθέ Hdt. 1.30, cf. 9.3; τῶν (sc. δενδρέων) γλυκὺς ἵ. ἔσχεν . . φυτεῦσαι Pi. O. 3.33: in pl., πολλοὶ γὰρ εἰς ἓν ξυμπίτνουσιν ἵ. various impulses or emotions, A. Ch. 299, cf. Phld. Ir. p.37 W., Piet. 20.

desire, love, ὥς σεο νῦν ἔραμαι καί με γλυκὺς ἵ. αἱρεῖ Il. 3.446; δὸς νῦν μοι φιλότητα καὶ ἵ. 14.198; δαμέντα φρένας ἱμέρῳ Pi. O. 1.41, cf. Sapph. 96.16 L.-P.; ἱμέρῳ πεπληγμένος A. Ag. 544; ἱμέρου νικώμενος Id. Supp. 1005, cf. Pr. 649, S. Tr. 476, Ar. Ra. 59; βλεφάρων ἵ. S. Ant. 796 (lyr.).

data.quote: ὥς σεο νῦν ἔραμαι καί με γλυκὺς ἵ. αἱρεῖ

children.definition: Χάριτές τε καὶ Ἵ. Hes. Th. 64; Ἔρως . . χαρίτων, ἱμέρου, πόθου πατήρ Pl. Smp. 197d, cf. Luc. Dear.Iud. [DDeor. 20.]15, Nonn. D. 1.68, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., only in neut. as Adv., ἵμερον αὐλήσαντι AP 9.266 (Antip.); ἵμερα μελίζεσθαι, δακρῦσαι, ib. 7.30 (Antip. Sid.), 364 (Marc. Arg.).— Poet., exc. in Pl. and Ion. and later Prose, as Hdt. ll. cc., Hp. Aër. 22, Phld. ll. cc., Acad.Ind. p.56M. (Sts. derived fr. is-mero-, cf. Skt. iṣṭás ‘desired’, iṣmás ‘god of love’, but Aeol. texts have ἴμερος, ἰμέρρω, never ἰμμ-; cf. ἡμερτόν· ἐπέραστον, Hsch. (s.v.l.).)
lovely in spirit, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr. 3.9.
of lovely voice or song, ἀηδών Sapph. 39, Alcm. 26 (vulg. ἱεροφ-), Theoc. 28.7.

longed for, desired, lovely, Τιταρήσιος Il. 2.751; ὕδατα A.R. 2.939; Σαλαμίς Sol. 1.1; κίθαρις h.Merc. 510; στέφανοι Hes. Th. 577; κόμα Sapph. 119; λέχος Pi. P. 3.99; ἀοιδαί, δόξα, Id. O. 6.7, P. 9.75; ἱ. ἡλικίη dear life, Simon. 115; of persons, AP 5.297 ( Jul.); epith. of Apollo and Dionysus, ib. 9.524.10,525.10.— Poet. and later Prose, as Epicur. Fr. 165, Luc. Dear.Iud. [DDeor. 20.]15: ἱμερτόν, τό, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.926f; ἐφʼ ἱμερτοῖσιν prob. from a poet, ib. Pyth. 394b.

definition: ἱμερώδης [ ῑ], ες, = ἱμερόεις, Callistr. Stat. 11.

children.definition: between, ἰ. Πελειᾶν Schwyzer 664.17 ( Orchom. Arc., iv B.C.); also ἰμέσουν τοῖς Διδύμοιυν ib. 25; prob. fr. ἰν( = ἐν) μεσ-.

definition: ἴμεστος δίκη ( Sicel), Hsch. ἱμητός [ ῑ], ή, όν, ( ἱμάω)

children.definition: drawn out as from a well, Id. ἰμίτραὁν· ὑπόζωσον ( -στον cod.) (Cypr.), Id.

definition: ἴμμεναι, poet. for ἴμεναι, ἰέναι, inf. of εἶμι ( ibo).
ἱμονιά [prob. ῑ, cf. An.Ox. 1.217], ἡ, ( ἱμάς)

children.definition: well-rope, Alex. 174.9, Apollod.Gel. 1 (pl.), Ph. 2.89 (pl.), Luc. Icar. 7, JConf. 8, Hsch.; ἱμονιάν (abs.) a ropeʼs length, i.e. as long as a bucket takes to go down and come up a well, Ar. Ec. 351.
water-drawer, Ar. Ra. 1297.

ἰμπάταὁν· ἔμβλεψον (Paph.), Id. ἰμπλατία, ἡ, Arc. for ἐμπλ-, a sacrificial cake, IG 5(2).4 ( Tegea, iv B.C.). ἰμπολά, v. ἐμπολή. ἰμπόλης· ληπτής, Hsch. (perh. Arc. for ἐμπολεύς). ἴμπτω, v. ἴπτω. Ἴμψιος, epith. of Poseidon in Syria, Hsch. ἵν, dat. and acc. of the old pers. Pron. ἵ (q.v.). ἰν, Arc., Cypr., and Cret. for ἐν (q.v.).

definition: ἵν or εἵν, gen. εἱνός, τό, an Egyptian and Jewish liquid measure, LXX Ex. 29.40, al., J. AJ 3.9.4, Eust. 1282.51 ( indecl. in LXX ll. cc.); cf. ἵνιον.

children.label: A
children.definition: Adv.,
in that place, there, once in Hom., ἵ. γάρ σφιν ἐπέφραδον ἠγερέθεσθαι Il. 10.127 (acc.to Eust.).

in which place, where, 2.558, Od. 9.136, Hdt. 2.133, 9.27, 54, Pi. O. 1.95, B. 10.79, A. Pr. 21, al., S. El. 22, 855, Ar. Ra. 1231, etc.: rarely in Att. Prose, Lys. 13.72 (v. infr.), Pl. Ap. 17c, Phlb. 61b; ἵ. ἡ Νίκη (sc. ἐστίν) IG 2(2).1407.13: rare in later Greek, Arr. An. 1.3.2, Luc. Cont. 22, Ind. 3: with particles, ἵ. τε Il. 20.478; ἵ. περ 24.382, Od. 13.364, Lys. l.c.; ἵνʼ ἄν c. subj., wherever, S. OC 405, E. Ion 315; as indirect interrog., Hdt. 1.179, 2.150, E. Hec. 1008.

children.label: b
children.definition: Hom., like other Advs. of Place, c. gen., ἵ. τῆς χώρης Hdt. 1.98; ἔμαθε ἵ. ἦν κακοῦ in what a calamity, Id. 1.213; οὐδʼ ὁρᾶν ἵνʼ εἶ κακοῦ S. OT 367; ἵνʼ ἕσταμεν χρείας ib. 1442; ἵνʼ ἦμεν ἄτης Id. El. 936; ὁρᾷς ἵνʼ ἐσμὲν αὐτοῦ πέρι τῆς ἀπορίας Pl. Sph. 243b.

data.quote: ὁρᾷς ἵνʼ ἐσμὲν αὐτοῦ πέρι τῆς ἀπορίας

children.label: c
children.definition: whither, Od. 4.821, al.; ὁρᾷς ἵνʼ ἥκεις S. OT 687, al., Din. 2.10; ιναπερ ὥρμητο Th. 4.74.

children.label: II
children.definition: γάμος . . , ἵ. χρή at which, when, Od. 6.27; ἵ. μὲν ἐξῆν αὐτοῖς . . , ἐνταῦθα . . when it was in their power, Antipho 6.9.
Il. 7.353 (v.l. ἵνʼ ἄν, cf. Sch.), Archil. 74.7 codd., v.l. in Din. 1.1, and Pl. Chrm. 176b.

children.label: B
children.definition: that, in order that, from Hom. downwards, mostly first word in the clause, but sts. preceded by an emphatic word, Pl. Chrm. 169d; ἵ. δή Il. 7.26, 23.207, Hdt. 1.29, Pl. R. 420e, 610c: never with ἄν or κε (if found, these particles belong to the Verb, as in Od. 12.156, E. IA 1579).
subj.,

children.label: a
children.definition: subj. and imper.: pres. ind., Il. 3.252, Od. 2.111, X. Mem. 3.2.3, Cyr. 1.2.11, Isoc. 3.2: pf. ind., Il. 1.203, Isoc. 4.129: fut., Od. 2.307, 4.591, X. Cyr. 1.2.15; subj., S. OT 364; imper., Il. 19.348, al., A. Pr. 61, S. Ph. 880, Ar. Ra. 297, Pl. R. 341b, Men. 71d.

children.label: b
children.definition: aor. is gnomic, Od. 5.490 ( αὔοι codd.); where aor. is treated as equiv. to pf., Il. 9.99, Od. 8.580, Hdt. 5.91, Lys. 1.4, D. 9.26: when the purpose is regarded from the point of view of the speakerʼs present, σὲ παῖδα ποιεύμην ἵ. μοι . . λοιγὸν ἀμύνῃς Il. 9.495, cf. Hdt. 1.29, 6.100, Th. 1.44, al., Lys. 1.11,12, al.

data.quote: σὲ παῖδα ποιεύμην ἵ. μοι . . λοιγὸν ἀμύνῃς

children.label: c
children.definition: ἄν, when opt. with οὐκ ἄν is used with sense of imper., Il. 24.264, Od. 6.58; after βουλοίμην ἄν . . , Lys. 7.12.

children.label: d
children.definition: impf. with ἄν, D. 23.7.

children.label: a
children.definition: Il. 5.3, Od. 3.2, A. Th. 215, Lys. 3.11, Pl. Prt. 314c, etc.: after the historical pres., E. Hec. 11: sts. both moods, subj. and opt., follow in consecutive clauses, Od. 3.77, Hdt. 8.76, 9.51, D. 23.93, 49.14.

children.label: b
children.definition: Od. 18.369, S. Ph. 325; βούλοιντʼ ἂν ἡμᾶς ἐξολωλέναι, ἵνα . . λάβοιεν Ar. Pax 413.

data.quote: βούλοιντʼ ἂν ἡμᾶς ἐξολωλέναι, ἵνα . . λάβοιεν

children.label: a
children.definition: Id. Cri. 44d.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἄν, to express a consequence which has not followed or cannot follow, S. OT 1389, Pl. Men. 89b, D. 29.17: esp. after ἐβουλόμην ἄν . . , Ar. V. 961, Lys. 4.3.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἐχρῆν, ἔδει, E. Hipp. 647, Pl. Prt. 335c, Smp. 181e, Euthd. 304e, Isoc. 9.5, D. 24.48, Men. 349.5, etc.: whenan unfulfilled obligation is implied, τεθαύμακα ὅτι οὐκ εἶπεν ( = ἔδει εἰπεῖν) . . ἵ . . . Pl. Tht. 161c; ἀντὶ τοῦ κοσμεῖν ( = δέον κοσμεῖν) . . ἵ . . . D. 36.47.

children.label: d
children.definition: pres. ind. in general statements (including the past), οὐδὲ γὰρ τὸ εἶναι ἔχει ἡ ὕλη, ἱ. ἀγαθοῦ ταύτῃ μετεῖχεν Plot. 1.8.5.

data.quote: οὐδὲ γὰρ τὸ εἶναι ἔχει ἡ ὕλη, ἱ. ἀγαθοῦ ταύτῃ μετεῖχεν

children.definition: ἵ. μή as the neg. of ἵνα, that not, Il. 19.348, etc.

Od. 3.327 with ib. 19), ἀξιοῦν ἵ . . . Decr. ap. D. 18.155; δεήσεσθαι ἵ . . . D.H. 1.83; παρακαλεῖν ἵ . . . Arr. Epict. 3.23.27: freq. in NT, ἐκήρυξαν ἵ. μετανοήσωσιν Ev.Marc. 6.12, al.; of will, ὅσα ἐὰν θέλητε ἵ. ποιῶσιν . . ib. 25: hence ἵ. c. subj. stands for infin., ἐν τούτῳ ἵ. καρπὸν φέρητε ( = ἐν τῷ φέρειν) Ev.Jo. 15.8, etc.; πρῶτόν ἐστιν ἵ. κοιμηθῶ Arr. Epict. 1.10.8, cf. M.Ant. 8.29; also for ὥστε, LXX Ge. 22.14, al., Plu. Alex. fort. 2.333a, Porph. Abst. 2.33, etc.
because, ἵ. ἀναγνῶ ἐτιμήθην I was honoured because I read, Anon. ap. A.D. Synt. 266.5, cf. Conj. 243.21, Choerob. in Theod. 2.257, al.; not found in literature.

children.label: a
children.definition: Ζεὺς ἔσθʼ, ἵνʼ εἰδῇς ʼtis Zeus,— [I tell thee this] that thou mayʼst know it, S. Ph. 989; ἵ. μὴ εἴπω ὅτι οὐδεμιᾷ Pl. R. 507d; ἵ. συντέμω D. 45.5; ἵνʼ ἐκ τούτων ἄρξωμαι Id. 21.43; ἵ. δῶμεν . . granted that . . , S.E. P. 2.34, cf. 1.79.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἵ. συντάξῃς order him . . , PCair.Zen. 240.12 (iii B.C.); ἵ. λαλήσῃς PSI 4.412.1 (iii B.C.); ἵ. ἐλθὼν ἐπιθῇς τὰς χεῖρας αὐτῇ Ev.Marc. 5.23, cf. 2 Ep.Cor. 8.7, LXX 2 Ma. 1.9, Arr. Epict. 4.1.41, Did. ap. Sch. S. OC 156.

data.quote: ἵ. ἐλθὼν ἐπιθῇς τὰς χεῖρας αὐτῇ

children.definition: appear, seem, ἄλλοι μοι δοκέουσι παροίτεροι ἔμμεναι ἵπποι, ἄλλος δʼ ἡνίοχος ἰνδάλλεται Il. 23.460; ἰνδάλλετο δέ σφισι πᾶσι τεύχεσι λαμπόμενος μεγαθύμου Πηλεΐωνος 17.213 ( -θύμῳ -ωνι Aristarch., cf. 2), cf. Od. 3.246, h.Ven. 178: ὥς μοι ἰνδάλλεται ἦτορ as my memory seems to me, or perh., as my heart pictures him, Od. 19.224; also in Att., ὥστʼ ἔμοιγʼ ἰνδάλλεται ὁμοιότατος κλητῆρος εἶναι πωλίῳ Ar. V. 188; τοῦτο γάρ μοι ἰ. διανοουμένη [ἡ ψυχή], οὐκ ἄλλο τι ἢ διαλέγεσθαι it seems to me to be merely engaged in a dialogue, Pl. Tht. 189e; τὰ διʼ ὀφθαλμῶν ἰνδαλλόμενα ἡμῖν Arist. Mu. 397b18, cf. lamb. Myst. 2.3; flash on oneʼs mind, ἀμφὶ δὲ . . μεληδόνες ἰνδάλλοντο appeared, A.R. 3.812, cf. 2.545.

data.quote: ἄλλοι μοι δοκέουσι παροίτεροι ἔμμεναι ἵπποι, ἄλλος δʼ ἡνίοχος ἰνδάλλεται

children.label: II
children.definition: direction, straight line, esp. vertical line, καθημένῳ πόδες ἐς τὴν ἄνω ἴ. κατʼ ἰθὺ γούνασι his feet when he is seated should be vertically opposite his knees, Hp. Off. 3; ἐπιδεῖν δεξιὰ ἐπʼ ἀριστερά, ἀριστερὰ ἐπὶ δεξιά, πλὴν κεφαλῆς· ταύτην δὲ κατʼ ἴξιν vertically, ib. 9; βάλλεσθαι χρὴ τὸ ὀθόνιον κατʼ αὐτὴν τὴν ἴ. τοῦ ἕλκεος directly over the wound, Id. Fract. 26; τοὺς νάρθηκας . . μὴ κατὰ τὴν ἴ. τοῦ ἕλκεος προστιθέναι ibid.; ὁκόσα κοινωνεῖ τοῖσι τῆς κνήμης ὀστέοισι καὶ αὐτέῃ τῇ ἴξει ib. 9 codd. ( κατὰ τὴν ἴξιν Gal. 18(2).423; κατʼ αὐτὴν τὴν ἴ. Ermerins).

κατʼ ἴξιν c. gen., corresponding to, on the same side as, ἤλγησεν κατὰ βουβῶνα, σπληνὸς κατʼ ἴ., i.e. on the spleen or left side of the body, Hp. Epid. 1.4.3 [1.26.γʹ], cf. 4.35, 37, Art. 33, Fract. 16, 18, Mul. 1.17; τῶν ὀδόντων τῶν τε ἄνω καὶ τῶν κάτω κατʼ ἴ. Id. Art. 31; = ex ipsa parte, Cass.Fel. 37; ἐν πυρετοῖσι ἀπὸ σπληνὸς καὶ ἥπατος διὰ ῥινῶν αἱμορραγέουσι, κατʼ ἴ. τοῦ σπλάγχνου τοῦ μυκτῆρος ῥέοντος the nostril corresponding to the organ in question, Aret. SA 2.2; ἡ κατʼ ἴ. κληίς the corresponding (i.e. liver or right side) collarbone, ib. 2.7, cf. CA 1.10; κατὰ τὴν ὄπισθεν ἴ. at the back of the leg, Hp. Art. 60.
in line with, κατʼ ἴ. τοῦ πυγαίου ποιησάμενον τὴν σανίδα ib. 75; κατʼ ἴ. τῇ ἐντομῇ τῇ ἐς τὸν τοῖχον ib. 47.
