Hom., Ἀργεῖοι ἰόμωροι, ἐλεγχέες Il. 4.242; Ἀργεῖοι ἰόμωροι, ἀπειλάων ἀκόρητοι 14.479. (Expld. by Sch. as caring for arrows (cf. μέριμνα), but ῐ is against this: perh. noisy (cf. ἰά).)

definition: ἴον [ ῐ], τό, heterocl. dat. pl. ἰάσῐ [ῑᾰ] Nic. Fr. 74.2:—

children.definition: violet, Viola odorata, στέφανοι ἴων Sapph. 94.12 L.-P., cf. Pi. O. 6.55, etc.; καὶ τὸ ἴον μέλαν ἐντί Theoc. 10.28, cf. AP 4.21 ( Mel.); κυαναυγές ib. 5.73 ( Rufin.); ἴ. τὸ μέλαν Thphr. HP 1.13.2, CP 1.13.12; ἴον alone, Dsc. 4.121:—in Od. 5.72, λειμῶνες μαλακοὶ ἴου ἠδὲ σελίνου θήλεον, there were vv.ll. σίου ( Ptol. Euerg.) and θρύου.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἴον τὸ λευκόν ( = λευκόϊον, q.v.) gilliflower, Matthiola incana, Thphr. HP 6.6.3; also ἴον alone, ib. 6.8.1.

children.label: IV
children.definition: flower, EM 473.10.

children.label: V
children.definition: Plin. HN 37.170. ( ϝίον, cf. γία· ἄνθη, Hsch., Lat. viola.)
shaggy, epith. of the wild goat, Od. 14.50.
root of a hair, young hair, ἰόνθους ἐκθλιβομένους Phld. Sign. 13, cf. Eun. Hist. p.250 D., Phryn. PS p.77 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: eruption on the face, which often accompanies the first growth of the beard, etc., Hp. Epid. 1.4.2 [1.26.βʹ], Arist. HA 556b29, Pr. 963b40, Erot. s.v. ὀλοφλυκτίδες :—hence ἰονθώδης, ες, ἐπάρσεις Thphr. Sud. 16, cf. Gal. 12.824.

of or called after Io, epith. of the sea between Epirus and Italy, at the mouth of the Adriatic sea, across which Io swam, πόντιος μυχὸς . . Ἰόνιος κεκλήσεται, τῆς σῆς πορείας μνῆμα A. Pr. 840; another expl. in Theopomp.Hist. 125; Ἰ. κόλπος Hdt. 6.127, Th. 1.24; θάλασσα, πόρος, Pi. P. 3.68, N. 4.53; also simply ὁ Ἰόνιος Th. 6.30; later Ἰόνιον πέλαγος AP 6.251 ( Phil.).

data.quote: πόντιος μυχὸς . . Ἰόνιος κεκλήσεται, τῆς σῆς πορείας μνῆμα

children.definition: become or be rusty, Arist. Col. 793b6, Thphr. Char. 10.14, Dsc. 5.78, Antig. Mir. 151.
become acrid, embittered, Hsch.:— Act. ἰόω, only late, rust, ὁ σίδηρος μᾶλλον ἰοῖ Olymp. in Mete. 266.26, cf. 270.14; convert into ἰός, Zos.Alch. pp. 148,238B.
with violet robe, Hsch.
with dark locks, Μοῖσαι Pi. P. 1.1, cf. Simon. 18.
= foreg., Alc. 55; κόρα, Νηρήιδες, B. 8.72, 16.37; Μοῖσαι Lyr.Adesp. 53; of Apollo, AP 9.524.10.
Zos.Alch. p.252B.

definition: ἰόππα μιξόδης, Hsch. ἴορκος, ὁ, v. δορκάς.
ἰός (A) [ ῑ], ὁ, pl. ἰοί, heterocl. ἰά Il. 20.68 (Cypr., acc. to AB 1095):—

children.definition: arrow, ἰὸν ἕηκε Il. 1.48; βλήμενος ἢ ἰῷ ἢ ἔγχεϊ 8.514, cf. A. Pers. 461; ἧκεν κομήτην ἰόν S. Tr. 567. (Cf. Skt. íṣ ‘arrow’.)

poison, as of serpents, A. Eu. 478, S. Tr. 771, E. Ion 1015, Plu. Vind. 2.562c, etc.; venom of a mad dog, Ruf. Fr. 118; ἰὸς ἀμεμφὴς μελισσῶν, of honey with which snakes fed Iamos, Pi. O. 6.47: metaph., of envy, A. Ag. 834. (Cf. Skt. viṣám ‘poison’, Lat. vīrus.)

rust on iron, or verdigris on copper and bronze, Sapph. 141 (dub.), Thgn. 451, Pl. R. 609a, Ti. 59c, Theoc. 16.17; ἰ. σιδήρου Dsc. 5.80; ἰ. χαλκοῦ Hp. Mul. 1.75, Dsc. 5.79, Gal. 12.218; patina on bronze statues, ὅπως καθαρὸς ἰοῦ ἔσται ὁ ἀνδριάς SIG 284.15 ( Chios, iv B.C.), cf. Plu. Pyth. 2.395b. (Perh. identical with ἰός B.)

data.quote: ὅπως καθαρὸς ἰοῦ ἔσται ὁ ἀνδριάς

children.definition: one, commonest in fem. (v. εἷς): neut. ἰῷ κίον ἤματι Il. 6.422: masc. dat. ἰῷ, = ἐκείνῳ, Leg.Gort. 8.8; but, = ἑνί, ib. 7.23; acc., τόν γʼ ἰὸν ἐνιαυτόν the same year, IG 5(1).1390.126 ( Andania, i B.C.); ἰός, = μόνος, acc. to Trypho ap. A.D. Pron. 56.4.
sugar of violets, Ruf. Fr. 80.
violet-crowned, epith. of Aphrodite, h.Hom. 6.18, Sol. 19.4; of the Muses, Thgn. 250; esp. of Athens, Pi. Fr. 76, cf. B. 5.3, Ar. Ach. 637, Eq. 1323.

will, desire, Ep. and Lyr. almost always in dat., θεῶν ἰότητι by the will of the gods, Il. 19.9, Od. 7.214, al., cf. Alc. 13A; μητρὸς ἐμῆς ἰότητι at her will, Il. 18.396; κακῆς ἰ. γυναικός Od. 11.384; μνηστήρων ἰ. 18.234; ἀλλήλων ἰ. Il. 5.874; ἀναιδήτῳ ἰ. with shameless will, A.R. 4.360: acc. only in Il. 15.41 διʼ ἐμὴν ἰ.

children.label: II
children.definition: for the sake of, ἰότατι γάμων A. Pr. 558 (lyr.).— Hsch. explains it by βουλήσει, αἰτία, ὀργῇ, χάριτι.
poison-bearing, venomous, Opp. C. 3.73.
arrow-stricken, AP 5.86 ( Rufin.), 9.265 ( Apollonid. or Phil.).

definition: ἰού or ἰοῦ (v. sub fin.), Interj., a loud cry expressive of sorrow, joy, or surprise,

children.definition: ἰοὺ ἰού D. 19.209; ἰ. ἰ. δύστηνος or δύστηνε, S. Tr. 1143, OT 1071; ἰ. ἰ. βοᾶν, κεκραγέναι, Ar. Nu. 543, Pax 345: c. gen., ἰ. ἰ. τῶν . . κιγκλίδων Jul. Caes. 330d: rarely once, φῦ ( φεῦ codd.), ἰ. τῆς ἀσβόλου Ar. Th. 245; or thrice, Id. Pax 110: with other Interj., ἰ. ἰ. ὢ ὢ κακά A. Ag. 1214; ἰ. ἰ. πόπαξ Id. Eu. 143 (lyr.).

hallo!, hurrah!, Id. Ag. 25, E. Cyc. 464, 576, Ar. Eq. 1096, Pl. R. 432d, Grg. 499b, Smp. 223a. (Sch. Ar. Pax 345, 316 says that ἰοὺ ἰού is of woe, ἰοῦ ἰοῦ of joy: the rule is not observed in codd. In Att. Poets it sts. stands extra versum, A. Ag. 25, Ar. Nu. 1.)
a Jewish man: Ἰουδαία, a Jewish woman; ἡ Ἰουδαία (sc. γῆ) Judaea: — Ἰουδα-ϊκός, ή, όν, Jewish, LXX 2 Ma. 8.11, etc. Adv. -κῶς J. BJ 6.1.3, Ep.Gal. 2.14, Cod.Just. 1.1.7.4:
side with or imitate the Jews, LXX Es. 8.17, Ep.Gal. 2.14:
in the Hebrew tongue, LXX 4 Ki. 18.26.

definition: Ἰουλαῖος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month in Lesbos (?), CIG 6850 A; in Cyprus, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.139:—also Ἰουλίηος, CIG 2827, 2836 ( Aphrodisias): Ἰούλιος,

children.definition: Julius, Hemerolog.Flor.
become downy or hairy, Tryph. 53, cf. Phot.
rainbow-wrasse, Coris iulis, Arist. HA 610b6, AP 7.504.5 ( Leon.), Numen. ap. Ath. 7.304f, Artem. 1.14.
footed like the centipede, i.e. many-footed, many-oared, of a ship, Lyc. 23.

down, the first growth of the whiskers and beard, in pl., πρίν σφωϊν ὑπὸ κροτάφοισιν ἰούλους ἀνθῆσαι Od. 11.319: later in sg., στείχει δʼ ἴ. ἄρτι διὰ παρηΐδων A. Th. 534; πρᾶτον ἴ. ἀπὸ κροτάφων καταβάλλειν Theoc. 15.85; ἔτι χνοάοντας ἰούλους ἀντέλλων A.R. 2.43; ὑπὸ κροτάφοισιν ἰούλους κειράμενος AP 6.198 (Antip. Thess.); ἰούλοις πλῆσαι παρειάς IG 14.1601.

data.quote: πρίν σφωϊν ὑπὸ κροτάφοισιν ἰούλους ἀνθῆσαι
στείχει δʼ ἴ. ἄρτι διὰ παρηΐδων

children.label: II
children.definition: corn-sheaf, whence Demeter is said to be named Ἰουλώ, Semus 19, Carm.Pop. 1.
song in honour of Demeter, Semus l.c., Apollod.Hist. 149 J., Eratosth. Fr. 10.

children.label: III
children.definition: catkin, Thphr. HP 3.5.5, 3.7.3; tendril, ib. 3.18.11.

children.label: IV
children.definition: creature like the centipede, prob. the wood-louse, Arist. HA 523b18, PA 682b3, Thphr. Sign. 19, Arat. 959; earthworm, Numen. ap. Ath. 7.305a.

children.label: V
children.definition: Eratosth. Fr. 12 (pl.). (Perh. cogn. with οὖλος, q.v.)
downy, γένυς Demitsas Μακεδ. No.410 ( Thessalonica, ii A.D.).
goddess of sheaves, epith. of Demeter, Semus 19; cf. ἴουλος II.
scolopendra-like, Arist. PA 682a5.

definition: ἰόφ, prob. corrupt in A. Supp. 828: interj. expressing aversion, acc. to Sch.
ἰοφόρος [ ῑ], ον, ( ἰός B, φέρω)

children.definition: poison-bearing, Opp. C. 3.433.

arrow-pourer, shooter of arrows, epith. of Artemis, Il. 5.53, etc.; ἰ. παρθένος Pi. P. 2.9: as Subst., Ἰοχέαιρα Il. 21.480, Od. 11.198, Schwyzer 758 (vi B.C.), IG 14.1389i53; later ἰ. φαρέτρα AP 6.9 ( Mnasalc.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἰός B) poison-shedding, of serpents, Nic. Fr. 33. ( -χέϝαιρα from χέω, not as expld. by Apollon.Lex. etc. from χαίρω.) [ῑ as in ἰός: yet ῐ in Pi. l.c.]
Parilia ( parelia, pardia codd.), Gloss.

definition: ἵπαμα κάμνη, Hsch. ἴπαρ, Aeol. for ὕπαρ, Jo.Gramm. Comp. 3.15. ἰπνασία· γαστήρ ( Tarent.), Hsch.

children.definition: furnarius, Gloss.; prob. for ἰπνίτης in AP 6.299 ( Phan.).
dry or bake in the oven, Hsch., prob. in IG 1(2).4.15 ( hιπν-).
woodpecker, Ant.Lib. 21.6; cf. ἴππα ( ἵπτα cod.): = δρυοκόλαψ, Hsch.: ἰπνή· ἐφιππίς ( Sicel), Id.

definition: ἰπνίον, τό, Dim. of ἰπνός, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.5.2.

children.definition: of an oven:—hence ἴπνια, τά, soot, Hsch., cf. Sch. Ar. V. 832.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἰπνός IV) of a dunghill, Call. Fr. 216.
baked in the oven, οἱ ἰ. ἄρτοι Hp. Vict. 2.42, Polem.Hist. 86, IG 5 (1).363.18 ( Sparta, i A.D.: written -είταν): without ἄρτος, Timocl. 33; ἰ. φθοΐς AP 6.299 ( Phan., sed leg. -ευτής).
baked in the oven, Luc. Lex. 6.
furnarius, Gloss. (also ἰπνο-καύτης, ibid.).

definition: ἰπνοκήιον φρύγιον, οἱ δὲ τὴν ὑπόκαυσιν τοῦ ἰπνοῦ, Hsch.

children.definition: boiler, cauldron, Luc. Lex. 8, Ath. 3.98c.

definition: ἰπνολεβήτιον, τό, Dim. of foreg., Poll. 10.66.

children.definition: mareʼs-tail, Hippuris vulgaris, Thphr. HP 4.10.1.
oven-maker, fire-clay moulder, worker in terra-cotta, much like κοροπλάθος (q. v.), Pl. Tht. 147a:—later ἰπνοπλάθης, Poll. 7.163, Tim. Lex., Harp.:—also ἰπνο-πλάστης, ου, ὁ, Gal. Thras. 43:

definition: ἰπνοποιός, όν, Luc. Prom.Es 2, Them. Or. 21.256d.

children.definition: oven, furnace, Hdt. 5.92.ηʹ, Hp. Morb. 2.47, Antiph. 176.4, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 2.54a, Archestr. Fr. 46; esp. for heating water for the bath, Ar. V. 139, Av. 437 ( ῐπν-).

children.label: II
children.definition: the place of the oven, i.e. the kitchen, Semon. 7.61, Ar. V. 837, Lycurg. Fr. 73.

children.label: III
children.definition: lantern, Ar. Pax 841, Pl. 815, SIG 1027.13 (Cos, 1v /iii B.C.), Ael. NA 2.8.

children.label: IV
children.definition: dunghill, privy, Ar. Fr. 353, Hsch. (Prob. cogn. with Engl. oven.)
kitchen, IG 11(2).287 A 147, al. ( Delos, iii B.C.).
killing the worms in vines, epith. of Heracles at Erythrae, Str. 13.1.64.

definition: ἶπος, ἡ (so in Pi. l.c.) or τό ( Eust. 844.39), in a mouse-trap,

children.definition: the piece of wood that falls and catches the mouse, Ar. Pl. ( 815?) ap. Poll. 10.155, Id. 7.41, Eust. 16.40, etc. cf. εἶπος.
any weight, fullerʼs press, Archil. 169; ἶ. ἀνεμόεσσα, of Aetna as the weight which holds Typhoeus down, Pi. O. 4.8; press used in surgery, Hp. Mochl. 38. (Perh. cf. ἴπτομαι.)

press, squeeze, Cratin. 91; esp. in surgery, Hp. Art. 47; ἰ. τὴν κεφαλὴν τοῦ βραχίονος Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.13.8:— Pass., to be weighed down, ἰπούμενος ῥίζαισιν Αἰτναίαις ὕπο A. Pr. 365; ἰπούμενος ταῖς ἐσφοραῖς Ar. Eq. 924.

definition: ἴππα, ἡ, v. sub ἴπνη: as pr. n. Ἵππα, Hippa, nurse of Dionysus, Orph. H. 48.4.
ἱππαγρέται, ῶν, οἱ, ( ἀγρέω) three officers at Lacedaemon,

children.definition: who chose 300, the flower of the ἔφηβοι, to serve as a body-guard for the kings (v. ἱππεύς II.1), X. HG 3.3.9, Lac. 4.3, Archyt. ap. Stob. 4.1.138: sg., Th. 4.38 (unless it be pr. n.).
wild horse, Opp. C. 3.252.

carrying horses; esp. of ships used as cavalry transports, πλοῖα Hdt. 6.48; νέες ib. 95; ναῦς Th. 2.56, 4.42, Arr. An. 2.19.1; τριήρεις D. 4.16, D.S. 11.3; ἱππαγωγοί alone, Ar. Eq. 599, D. 4.21: Ἱππαγωγός as pr. n. of a ship, IG 2(2).1623.14.

definition: ἱππάζομαι, Dor. fut. 3 sg. ἱππασεῖται Dialex. 6.4:—

children.definition: drive horses, drive a chariot, Ἀντίλοχʼ, ἀφραδέως ἱππάζεαι Il. 23.426; later, ride, Hdt. 4.114, Hp. Aër. 17, Ar. Nu. 15, etc.; ἱ. ἐφʼ ἵππων Hdt. 4.110; ἵππῳ X. Eq. 10.1: metaph., ἁ ξυσμὰ ἐκ ποδὸς εἰς κεφαλὰν ἱππάζεται Sophr. 53:—rare in Act., ἱππάσαι πῶλον ap. Poll. 1.182.

data.quote: ἁ ξυσμὰ ἐκ ποδὸς εἰς κεφαλὰν ἱππάζεται

children.definition: Pass., of the horse, to be ridden or driven, Pl. Ion 540e; to be broken in for riding, X. Eq. 3.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱππάζεσθαι χώραν ride over a country, Plu. Cam. 23; τὰς ὁδούς D.S. 13.88.
ἱππηΐς, fem. of ἱππικός I.3, of a knight, πόρπα, i.e. fibula which fastened the trabea of a Roman eques, Epigr.Gr. 985.1 ( Philae).
cavalry-action, Sch. Pi. N. 1.23 (pl.).
fighting on horseback, equestrian, Pi. N. 1.17.
mareʼs-milk cheese, used by the Scythians, Hp. Aër. 18, A. Fr. 198, Theopomp.Hist. 48, Thphr. HP 9.13.2, Dsc. 2.71:—also ἱππάκης, ου, ὁ, Eust. 916.16.
horseʼs rennet, Dsc. 2.75.

children.label: II
children.definition: a leguminous plant, Ph. Bel. 86.25, Plin. HN 25.83.
mounted javelineer, Ael. Tact. 2.13, Arr. An. 4.4.7, Poll. 1.131.
remedy for horses, Hippiatr. 130.
horse-cock, gryphon, a fabulous animal in A. Fr. 134, cf. Ar. Ra. 932, Av. 800.

definition: ἱππαλέος, α, ον, poet. for ἱππικός, Opp. C. 1.169, 242, etc.

children.definition: monsoon in the Indian Ocean (from the name of the pilot who observed it), prob. in Peripl.M.Rubr. 57.
mounted man, PLond. 1821.80.
centaur, Gal. UP 3.1, Eust. 1909.53.

definition: ἱππαπαῖ, a cry of the Ἱππεῖς, a parody of the boatmenʼs cry ( ῥυππαπαῖ), Ar. Eq. 602.

children.definition: Dim. of ἵππος, pony, PCair.Zen. 30, al. (iii B.C.), Arr. Tact. 19.3.
wretched horse, in contempt, X. Cyr. 1.4.19, Plu. Phil. 7, Them. Or. 24.306d.
statuette of a horse, IG 11(2).203 B 84 ( Delos, iii B.C.).

definition: ἱππαρμοστής, οῦ, ὁ, Laced. for ἵππαρχος,

children.definition: commander of cavalry, X. HG 4.4.10, 5.12; cf. ἵπφαρμος.
head-quarters of the ἵππαρχος, IG 2(2).895 (ii B.C.).

to be ἵππαρχος, command cavalry, c. gen., τῆς ἵππου Hdt. 9.20, 69; ἱππαρχηκὼς ἀνδρῶν καλῶν κἀγαθῶν Din. 3.12; ἱππέων D. 21.164: abs., X. Ages. 2.4, Lys. 26.20, D. 21.172; οἱ ἱππαρχηκότες Hyp. Lyc. 17; of the Roman magister equitum and praefectus equitum, D.C. 43.48, App. BC 5.8:— Pass., serve under an ἵππαρχος, Arist. Pol. 1277b10.

definition: ἱππάρχης, Dor. ἱππ-άρχας, Ion. gen. ἱππάρχεω IG 12(8).194.7 ( Samothrace), Michel 596 ( Cyzicus), ὁ,

children.definition: ἵππαρχος, OGI 217 ( Caria, iii B.C., pl.), Plb. 10.22.6 (Achaean), 18.22.2 (Macedonian), cf. LXX 2 Ki. 1.6, PTeb. 54.2 (i B.C.), Plu. Tim. 32; at Sparta, IG 5(1).32A, al.; = Lat. magister equitum, Plb. 3.87.9, D.H. 5.75, Nic.Dam. 130.17J., etc.; = praefectus equitum, App. BC 2.102; = praefectus alae, J. BJ 2.14.5.
office of ἵππαρχος, X. Ath. 1.3 (pl.); of the magister equitum, D.C. Fr. 36.26, Lyd. Mag. 2.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: a squadron of horse such as he commands, Plb. 10.23.4, D.S. 17.57, Str. 17.1.12, Plu. Eum. 7, Arr. An. 1.24.3; consisting of 512 men, Ascl. Tact. 7.11, etc.
of or for a ἵππαρχος, ἡγεμονία ἱ.,= ἱππαρχία, Suid. s.v. ἵππαρχος; ἱ. ἐστί it is part of his duty, X. Eq.Mag. 5.1: -ικός, ὁ (sc. λόγος), title of treatise by Xenophon.
ruling the horse, epith. of Poseidon, Pi. P. 4.45.

children.label: II
children.definition: commander of cavalry, τῆς ἵππου Hdt. 7.154; at Athens, IG 2(2).116.15 (iv B.C.), Ar. Av. 799, Lys. 16.8, Pl. Lg. 755c, 880d, X. Eq.Mag. 1.7, al.; ἵ. εἰς Λῆμνον χειροτονεῖν Hyp. Lyc. 17, cf. D. 4.26; in other states, Th. 4.72, IG 7.2466 ( Thebes, iii B.C.), etc.; in the Achaean league, ib. 5(2).344.7 ( Orchomenus), etc.; = Lat. magister equitum, D.S. 12.64, Plu. Cam. 5, etc.; = praefectus equitum, App. Hisp. 47; cf. ἱππάρχης.

definition: ἱππάς, άδος, ἡ, pecul.fem. of ἱππικός, ἱ. στολή

children.definition: a riding-dress, Hdt. 1.80; = Lat. equester, ἱ. ἐσθής D.C. 38.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἡ ἱ. (sc. τάξις) the order of knights ( ἱππεῖς) at Athens, Arist. Pol. 1274a21; θυσίαι, βοῦς ἱππάδες of sacrifices offered by the knights, Hsch.; πύλαι ἱ., name of a gate at Athens, Plu. VOrat. 2.849c.
knights’ tax, ἱππάδα τελεῖν Is. 7.39, Arist. Ath. 7.4, Plu. Sol. 18; θητικοῦ ἀντὶ τέλους ἱππάδʼ ἀμειψάμενος Epigr. ap. Arist. Ath. l.c.
ordo equester, D.C. 40.57, al.; in full ἡ ἱ. τάξις Hdn. 5.1.5.
= ἵππος, ἡ, mare, Opp. C. 1.162, Hippiatr. 14, BGU 21iii 8 (iv A.D.).

riding, horse-exercise, Ar. Ach. 1165 (lyr.); ἱ. ποιεῖσθαι,= ἱππάζεσθαι, to take a ride, X. Eq. 8.9, cf. An. 2.5.33; ἱ. ἱππάσασθαι Id. Oec. 11.17; horsemanship, Id. An. 2.5.33; as a subject of competition, IG 7.3087 (Lebad.).
chariot-driving, Luc. DDeor. 20[12].1, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: cavalry, Arr. An. 4.4.7.

fit for horses, fit for riding, Αἴγυπτον τὸ πρὶν ἐοῦσαν ἱππασίμην καὶ ἁμαξευομένην, opp. ἄνιππος, Hdt. 2.108, cf. 5.63, 9.13, X. Cyr. 1.4.14, Aen.Tact. 6.6, Plb. 10.49.5, Onos. 31.1, etc.; τὸ ἱππάσιμον, i.e. τὸ πεδινόν, X. HG 7.2.12; τὰ ἱ. τῆς χώρας ἄνιππα ποιεῖν Aen.Tact. 8.4: metaph., τοῖς κόλαξιν ἑαυτὸν ἀνεικὼς ἱππάσιμον allowing himself to be ridden by flatterers, Plu. Alex. 23.

data.quote: τὰ ἱ. τῆς χώρας ἄνιππα ποιεῖν

definition: ἱππάσιον, τό, Dim. of ἵππος, Theognost. Can. 125.

children.definition: a ride, Ach.Tat. 1.13.
riding, Sch. E. Hel. 1355.

definition: ἱππαστήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., metaph. of the μύωψ, AP 5.202 ( Asclep.); κημός ib. 7.424 (Antip. Sid.).
ἱππαστής, οῦ, ὁ, = ἱππευτής, Luc. Am. 46.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., fit for riding, of a horse, X. Eq. 10.17.
like a horseman, καθίζειν Hsch.
fond of riding, Plu. Alc. 23.
that can be ridden, Arist. HA 576b17.
dromedaries, Plu. Eum. 15.

starting-post in a race-course, Plb. Fr. 52 (pl.), Abh.Berl.Akad. 1904(2).9 (Pap., ii B.C.), D.H. 3.68 (pl.), Epigr. ap. Paus. 6.20.14 ( Olymp.), prob. in SIG 251 H ii 63, 253 U ( Delph., iv B.C.):—also ἱππάφια, τά, Tab.Defix.Aud. 234.21 ( Carthage, i A.D.).
caballi ammissi, carceres, Gloss. (prob. -αφέσεις).
riding or driving of horses, horsemanship, racing, S. El. 505 (lyr.): pl., E. HF 374 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: cavalry, X. An. 5.6.8, Ages. 1.23.

children.label: III
children.definition: breed of horses, ἐνδόξου γενομένης ἐνθένδε ἱ. Str. 5.1.9.

of a horse or horses, ζυγόν, φάτνη, Il. 5.799, 10.568; κάπαι Od. 4.40; ἵ. λόφος horse-hair crest, Il. 15.537; ἔντεα Pi. N. 9.22; γένος, μάνδραι, S. Ant. 341 (lyr.), Fr. 659.3; ἔθειραι Theoc. 16.81; τὸ ἵππειον [γάλα] Arist. HA 522a28, Posidon. ap. Gal. 19.712; κάλω ἱππείω δύο IG 1(2).330.19. Adv. -είως Dam. Pr. 58.
ἵππειος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month at Thronion, Klio 16.176 (Delph.). ( ἵππιος is the usual form in Trag., ἱππικός in Prose.)

definition: ἱππελάτειρα [ᾰ], fem. of sq., Orph. H. 32.12.

children.definition: driver or rider of horses, Opp. C. 1.95.
horse-deer, perh. nylghau, Portax picta, Arist. HA 498b32; ἡ θήλεια ἱ. οὐκ ἔχει κέρατα ib. 499b2.
lover of horses, Ael. NA 2.28.
horse-fever, formed after ἴκτερος, ὕδερος, etc., with a pun on ἔρος ( = ἔρως), Ar. Nu. 74.
ride on horseback or journey in a chariot, E. IT 1428; [ Νύξ], μακρὸν ἵ. διώκεις Id. Fr. 114 (lyr.).

definition: ἱππεύς, gen. έως ( -έω dub. in Hsch.), Ep. ῆος, ὁ, ( ἵππος)

children.definition: one who fights from a chariot, Hom. (only in Il.), opp. πεζός, 2.810; either of the driver or of the hero who fights, 12.66, 15.270; also of one who drives in a chariot-race, 23.262.
horseman, rider, cavalryman, ἰππήων στρότος Sapph. Supp. 5.1, cf. Hdt. 3.88, 9.49, A. Pers. 14 (anap.), Arist. Pol. 1270a29, etc.; τῆς πολιτείας ἱ. a public courier, Aristaenet. 1.26.
groom, Class.Rev. 27.12 (Laodicea Combusta), 24.12, JHS 18.108 (near Lysias).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱππεῖς, in social and political sense, knights, forming an aristocracy in early Greek communities, Arist. Pol. 1297b18, etc.; at Eretria, ib. 1306a35, Ath. 15.2; at Sparta, a royal bodyguard, Hdt. 8.124, cf. 1.67, etc.; esp. at Athens, the Second Class in Solonʼs constitution, Arist. Ath. 7.3; later, an aristocratic corps of cavalry, Ar. Eq. 225, And. 3.5, Philoch. 100, etc.

equites, D.S. 37.8, D.H. 4.24, App. BC 1.22, etc.; ἱππεὺς Ῥωμαίων,= Lat. eques Romanus, Mon.Anc.Gr. 7.17, IG 3.768a, IGRom. 3.204 ( Ancyra), OGI 547.2 (ibid.), 645.7 ( Palmyra), prob. in IGRom. 4.1213 ( Thyatira).

children.label: III
children.definition: nimble kind of crab, Arist. HA 525b8.

children.label: IV
children.definition: comet, Plin. HN 2.90, Lyd. Ost. 11.

children.label: V
children.definition: girlʼs ornament, Hsch., cf. Ostr. 323 (ii B.C.).

children.label: VI
children.definition: measure, πυρῶν, ἀμυγδάλων, ἀλεύρων, Supp.Epigr. 2.710 ( Pednelissus).
riding, in pl., Sch. E. Ph. 791.
πῶλος, ἱ. πεδίων, οὐχ ἁλός AP 9.295 (Bianor).
rider, horseman, Pi. P. 9.123: as Adj., Τρῶες B. 12.160; στρατός E. HF 408 (lyr.).

to be a horseman or rider, ride, Hdt. 1.136, etc.; ἱ. ταῖς κυούσαις ἵπποις Arist. HA 576a21; ἱ. ἐπʼ ὄνου Luc. Bacch. 2; of a people, ἱππεύει ταῦτα τὰ ἔθνη Hdt. 7.84, cf. 87:—also in Med., Id. 1.27, 79.
ζεφύρου πνοαῖς ἱππεύσαντος E. Ph. 212 (lyr.); σελάνα ἱππεύουσα διʼ ὀρφναίας Id. Supp. 994 (lyr.); also, rush, πρὸς φόνον Id. HF 1001.

children.label: II
children.definition: serve in the cavalry, Lys. 14.7, X. HG 3.1.4, Pl. Lg. 756b, etc.
to be an eques, D.C. 49.12; τὸ -εῦον the ordo equester, Id. 60.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: rides ( i.e. carries his rider) well’, X. Eq. 1.6, 3.4, 10.3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: drive a team, Ar. Nu. 1406.
driver of horses, of Poseidon, Lyc. 767.
Philoch. 132, Plb. 1.27.9, D.S. 20.83; τριήρης Ἱππηγός as pr. n., IG 2(2).1628.423,1629.944.
like a horse, A. Th. 328 (lyr.), Supp. 431 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: like a horseman, Ar. Pax 81.
driving or riding of horses, Hld. 8.14, Them. Or. 15.188a, 18.216d:— Adj. ἱππ-ηλάσιος, α, ον, fit for riding or driving, ἱ. ὁδός chariot-road, Il. 7.340.
ride or drive, Ar. Av. 1443.

driver of horses, one who fights from a chariot, Hom. (always in Ep. from ἱππηλάτα, and only in nom.), as an epith. of honour, Knight, ἱ. Τυδεύς, γέρων ἱ. Πηλεύς, Φοῖνιξ, Οἰνεύς, Il. 4.387, 7.125, 9.432, 581; Νέστωρ Od. 3.436: generally ἱππηλάται E. Rh. 117: as Adj., ἱ. λεώς, opp. πεδοστιβής, A. Pers. 126 (lyr.).

fit for horsemanship or driving, νῆσος Od. 4.607; γαῖα 13.242; ὁδὸς ἱ. chariot-road, Luc. Rh.Pr. 3, Poll. 9.37; ἱ. οἶδμα Nonn. D. 20.157; θάλασσα Agath. 4.29, cf. 5.11; ἱ. ἔργον Ἀθήνης, i.e. the Trojan horse, Tryph. 2; τὸ διʼ ἡδονῆς καθάπερ ἱ. τι χωρίον Porph. Marc. 6.

data.quote: τὸ διʼ ἡδονῆς καθάπερ ἱ. τι χωρίον

children.definition: milking of mares, Scymn. 855 (pl.).
the Mare-milkers, a Scythian or Tartar tribe, Il. 13.5, cf. Str. 7.3.2; Σκύθαι ἱ. Hes. Cat.Oxy. 1358 Fr. 2.15; ἱ. Κιμμέριοι Call. Dian. 252.
ape Hippias, Philostr. VS 2.21.3.
king of horsemen, A. Pers. 996 (lyr.).
Apul. ap. Lyd. Mens. 4.7.

definition: ἱππιατρός (on the accent v. Hdn. Gr. 1.229), ὁ,

children.definition: veterinary surgeon, farrier, IG 9(2).69.5 (ii B.C.), PGen. 42.35 (iii A.D.), Hippiatr. 12, etc.; cf. ἱπποϊατρός:— Adj.

senses.definition: of or for farriery: ἱππιατρικόν, τό, a work on farriery, Suid. s.v. Χείρων: -κά, τά, title of extant compilation: also -κόν, τό, tax on farriers, PHib. 1.45.21 (iii B.C.).

children.definition: a kind of fish, Epich. 44.
of a horse or horses, freq. in Trag., ἱ. ἐκ πλευμόνων A. Th. 61; ἱ. φρυάγματα ib. 245, cf. S. El. 717, 719; ὀχήματα, ἄντυγες, ib. 740, Aj. 1030; φάτναι E. Ba. 509.
of horsemen or chariots, ἀγών Hdt. 1.167, And. 4.26 (pl.); in ἱππικῶν ἀγών S. El. 698, ἱππικῶν is prob. neut. (v. infr. IV); δρόμος ib. 754; ναυάγια ib. 730; ἆθλον Pl. Lg. 949a.
= Lat. equester, τάξις, ἀξίωμα, D.H. 12.1, Plu. Pomp. 23; of persons, of equestrian rank, ἱ. ἄνδρες Str. 3.4.20, cf. IGRom. 3.474 ( Lycia, iii A.D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: of riding or horsemanship, equestrian, X. HG 5.3.20; ἱ. ἄσκησις training in horsemanship, IG 2(2).1042.21, al.; ἱ. ἡγήτωρ leader of the knights, ib. 3.693; skilled in riding, opp. ἄφιππος, Pl. Prt. 350a, al.: Comp., Satyr. 1, Phld. Mus. p.6 K.: Sup., Arr. Tact. 16.9.

ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη), horsemanship, riding, Ar. Nu. 27, etc.; περὶ -κῆς, title of treatise by Xenophon; ἱ. ἐπιστήμη Pl. La. 193b; ἱ. λόγοι X. HG 5.3.20; τὰ ἱ. [πράγματα] Pl. Alc. 1.124e, cf. Thg. 126a; ἡ ἐμὴ ἱ. this riding of mine, Lys. 24.10.

children.label: III
children.definition: fit for riding, Sup. -ώτατον, χρῆμα γυνή Ar. Lys. 677.

children.label: IV
children.definition: τὸ ἱ. the horse, cavalry, Hdt. 7.87, E. Supp. 682, X. An. 6.5.29, etc.; τὰ ἱ. Plb. 3.114.5.
course or space of four stadia, Plu. Sol. 23.

children.label: b
children.definition: circus at Rome, Tab.Defix.Aud. 187.59.

children.label: V
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς like a horseman: Sup. -κώτατα with best horsemanship, X. Oec. 21.7.

definition: ἵππιος, α, ον, ( ἵππος) poet. form of ἵππειος (q. v.),

children.definition: of a horse or horses, λόφοι crests of horsehair, Alc. 15.2; σθένος ἵ. Pi. P. 2.12; Ἄργος ἵ. (cf. ἱππόβοτος) Id. I. 7(6).11, B. 18.15; δρομεύς, prob. l. in E. El. 825; ἄνασσα ἱ. Queen of the Amazons, Id. Hipp. 307; epith. of Poseidon as creator of the horse, B. 16.99, A. Th. 130 (lyr.), Ar. Eq. 551, Nu. 83, IG 1(2).310.142, etc.; hence, of Colonos as sacred to him, Arg. S. OC, Paus. 1.30.4 (but cf. Pherecr. 134); also of Athena, Pi. O. 13.82, S. OC 1070 (lyr.), Harp.; of Hera, at Olympia, Paus. 5.15.5; of Ares, Id. 5.15.6, cf. Tryph. 105.

children.label: II
children.definition: of horsemen or the horse-race, ἵ. νόμος Pi. O. 1.101; ἱππίαν ἔσοδον Id. P. 6.50; ἄεθλα AP 6.312 (Anyte); sc. ἀγών SIG 1064.8 ( Halic., i B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Ἵππιος, ὁ (sc. μήν), month at Rhegium, IG 14.612.
shaggy with horsehair, λόφος Il. 6.469.
one who fights from a chariot, 24.257, Od. 11.259, Hes. Fr. 7; later, horseman, rider, A. Pers. 29 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., ἱ. κλόνοι the tumult of the horse-fight, ib. 105; cf. ἱπποχάρμης.

definition: ἱππίσκος, ὁ, Dim. of ἵππος, name of a play by Alexis, Ath. 3.120b.

children.definition: small statue of a horse, Michel 832.41 ( Samos, iv B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: an ornament for the head (cf. ἱππεύς v), Cratin.Jun. 5, Hsch.
astride, Ἀφροδίτη ἱ. καθημένη ἐπὶ Ψυχῆς PMag.Par. 1.1724.

definition: Ἱππιών, ῶνος, ὁ (sc. μήν), month at Eretria, IG 11 (4).1066b21 (found in Delos).
ἱπποβάμων [ ᾱ], ον, gen. ονος, ( βαίνω)

children.definition: going on horseback, equestrian, Ἀριμασπὸν ἱπποβάμονα στρατόν A. Pr. 805; στρατὸς ἱ., of centaurs, S. Tr. 1095.
trotting like a horse, or used for riding, κάμηλοι A. Supp. 284 (cj. Turneb.).
ῥήματα ἱ. high-paced words, bombast, fustian, Ar. Ra. 821.
horseman, A. Pers. 26 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱ. ἵππος or ὄνος, stallion, Str. 8.8.1, Hippiatr. 14; cf. ἱπποβότης.

definition: Ἱππόβινος, ὁ, ( βινέω) comic distortion of the pr. n. Ἱππόνικος,= ἱππόπορνος, Ar. Ra. 433.

children.definition: horses’ keep, Theognost. Can. 125.
feeding horses, Ael. NA 6.10, Suid., Gloss.
feeder of horses, Ἀτρεύς E. Or. 1000 (lyr., but prob. -βώτα), IA 1059 (but prob. -βάτας).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱπποβόται, οἱ, at Chalcis in Euboea a social class (cf. ἱππεύς II), Knights, Hdt. 5.77, 6.100; ἡ ἱπποβοτῶν πολιτεία Arist. Fr. 603.

grazed by horses, Od. 4.606, E. Andr. 1229 (anap.), IG 1(2).1034, Just. Nov. 25.1; ἡ ἱ., at Chalcis, Ael. VH 6.1 (cf. foreg.); esp. of the plain of Argos, from the rich pastures of Lerna, Il. 2.287, al., B. 10.80, E. Supp. 365 (lyr.).
horse-herd, horse-keeper, S. Fr. 1057, E. Ph. 28.

definition: ἱππόβροτοι ὠδῖνες pangs that gave birth

children.definition: to a horse and man (Pegasus and Chrysaor), Lyc. 842.
crane-cavalry, Luc. VH 1.13.
judging well of horses: hence generally, quick in judging, τινος A. Fr. 243, cf. Hsch.
vulture-cavalry, Luc. VH 1.13.
Poll. 1.181, Hsch.
tamer of horses, Hom., epith. of heroses, Il. 2.23, Od. 3.17; Τρῶες Il. 4.352, etc.; Γερηνοί Hes. Fr. 15; ἥρωες Pi. N. 4.29:—fem. Ἱππο-δάμεια, as pr. n., Hippodamia, Il. 2.742, etc.

definition: ἱπποδάσεια [ ᾰ], ἡ, fem. Adj., Ep. epith. of κόρυς and κυνέη,

children.definition: bushy with horsehair, 3.369, Od. 22.111, etc.
horse-bands, reins, E. Hipp. 1225:
Adj. δακτύλιοι ἱππόδεσμοι, snaffle-rings, IG 2(2).1542.25.
binding horses, ῥυτήρ S. Aj. 241 (anap.); epith. of Heracles at Thebes and Onchestos, Paus. 9.26.1.
whirled in chariots, Συρακόσιοι, B. 5.2.
driver or rider of steeds, Theoc. 14.12, Hsch.; a kind of gladiator, IGRom. 4.1455 ( Smyrna).

horse-race or chariot-race, Pi. P. 4.67, I. 3.13, X. Smp. 1.2, Pl. Ion 537a, Arist. Ath. 60.1, IG 2(2).784 (iii B.C.), SIG 730.30 ( Olbia, i B.C.); ἱ. ἄγειν Ar. Pax 900; ποιεῖν Th. 3.104; ἱ. παιδική, ἣν καλοῦσι Τροίαν,= Lat. ludus Troiae, Plu. Cat.Mi. 3.
of horse-racing, ἀγών Sch. Il. 23.757.
of the horse-race: -δρόμιος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month in Boeotia, IG 7.531, al. ( Tanagra), cf. Plu. Cam. 19; at Delphi, GDI 1987, al.; at Naupactus, IG 9(1).359.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἵππιος), Pi. I. 1.54.
chariot-road, λεῖος δʼ ἱ. ἀμφίς Il. 23.330.

race-course for chariots, Pl. Criti. 117c, D. 47.53; at Olympia, Paus. 6.20.15; at Delphi, SIG 636.24 (ii B.C.); at Andania, IG 5(1).1390.31; at Rome, the circus, D.H. 1.79; ὁ μέγας ἱ.,= circus maximus, Id. 5.36, Mon.Anc.Gr. 10.8: comic metaph., ἱ. οὗτός ἐστί σου μαγειρικῆς Posidipp. 26.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱπποδρόμος, ὁ, light horseman, ἱ. ψιλοί Hdt. 7.158.

definition: ἱπποζώνη, ἡ, acc. -ζώνην, f.l. for ὑπὸ ζώνην, Hippiatr. 26; the gloss in Hsch. is missing.

children.definition: forth from the horse, of the heroes descending from the Trojan horse, Od. 8.515, 11.531.
equa, Gloss.
ass which has been suckled by a mare, such being kept for the stud, acc. to Arist. HA 577b17.
swift-riding, Hsch.: in Il. only as pr. n.
covering mares, esp. of a he-ass kept for breeding mules, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., ἱ. νόμος a tune played to a mare, while she was being covered, Plu. Coniug. 2.138b, QConv. 704f.
sanctuary of Hippothoon, Hsch.
sacrifice horses, τῷ Ἡλίῳ Str. 11.8.6.
Hippiatr. 27, CIG 1953 (Maced.), POxy. 92 (iv A.D.).

definition: ἱπποκάμπιον, τό, Dim. of ἱππόκαμπος, Epich. 115.

children.label: II
children.definition: ear-ring, Poll. 5.97.
monster with horseʼs body and fishʼs tail, on which the sea-gods rode, Men. 831; ἑστήκει Ποσειδῶν χάλκεος, ἔχων ἱ. ἐν τῇ χειρί Str. 8.7.2, cf. Philostr. Im. 1.8.

data.quote: ἑστήκει Ποσειδῶν χάλκεος, ἔχων ἱ. ἐν τῇ χειρί

children.definition: the sea-horse, Dsc. 2.3, Ael. NA 14.20, Gal. 12.362.
horse-beetle, Com. word in Ar. Pax 181.
travelling by means of horses: driver of horses, epith. of Patroclus, Il. 16.126, 584, 839; rider, AP 9.210.
of a centaur, S.E. M. 9.125.
horse-centaur, half-horse half-man, Pl. Phdr. 229d, X. Cyr. 4.3.17: also as fem., θήλειαν ἱ. ἐποίησεν Luc. Zeux. 3.
stinging horses, Tz. H. 9 No. 290 tit.
pudenda muliebria, Ar. Fr. 703.
stable, Raccolta Lumbroso 374.
groom horses, ἱ. κάνθαρον groom his beetle, Ar. Pax 74.
groom, esquire, who attended the ἱππεύς in war, Hdt. 3.85, 88, X. HG 2.4.6: generally, groom, Pl. Plt. 261d, PSI 4.371.13 (iii B.C.), Plb. 13.8.3, etc.; ἱ. τῶν καμήλων Philostr. VA 2.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. ἱππό-κομος, ον, ( κόμη) decked with horsehair, epith. of a helmet (not in Od.), κόρυς Il. 13.132, cf. S. Ant. 116 (anap.); πήληξ Il. 16.797; τρυφάλεια 13.339.

definition: ἱπποκόρυθος, ον, coined as compd. of ἵππος and κόρυς, Porph. ad Il. 2.1 ( v.l. ἱππο-κόρυθες as nom. pl.).

children.definition: marshaller, arranger of chariots, ἀνέρες ἱπποκορυσταί Il. 2.1, 24.677; epith. of the Paeonians, 16.287, 21.205.
horse-trappings, Hsch. s.v. φάλαρα, Charis. p.549K., Gloss.
tender of horses, epith. of Poseidon at Sparta, Paus. 3.14.2.
Hippocratic, διδασκαλία Gal. 6.753, cf. 15.147; ἀπολίνωσις Paul.Aeg. 6.78. Adv. -ως Gal. UP 8.3.
to be superior in horse, D. 19.148, Plb. 3.66.2, Onos. 31.1:— Pass., to be inferior in horse, Th. 6.71.
victory in a cavalry action, X. Cyr. 1.4.24.

definition: ἱπποκράτωρ [ ᾰ], ορος, ὁ, the constellation Centaurus, Teucer in Boll Sphaera 20.

children.definition: tremendously steep, ἱ. ῥῆμα a neck-breaking word, Ar. Ra. 929.

definition: ἱπποκρήνη, ἡ, = Ἵππου κρήνη, the spring of Pegasus on Helicon, v.l. in Str. 9.2.25.

children.definition: sounding with the tramp of horses, ὁδός Pi. P. 5.92; γυμνάσια E. Hipp. 229 (anap.); ἱ. δάπεδα γυμνάσιά τε Id. Hel. 207 (lyr.), cf. AP 12.131 ( Posidipp.): in late Prose, Chor. Lyd. 17.
half-mare half-bitch, epith. of the moon-goddess, PMag.Par. 1.2614.
Rumex aquaticus, dock-sorrel, Dsc. 2.115, Gal. 12.56.
moss used in farriery, Sch. Nic. Th. 945.
destroyer of horses, Hdn. Epim. 211.
having given birth to a horse, Δηώ Orac. ap. Paus. 8.42.6.

definition: ἱππολήπτρας τὰς τριχίνους σειρὰς Πάρθυι οὕτω καλοῦσιν, Hsch. ( -λημπρα cod., fort. -λήμπτρας).
ἱππολούστρας ἔνθα τοὺς ἵππους ἀπένιζον, Hsch.

children.definition: horseʼs mane, Iamb. post Polem.p.50 Hinck.
with horsehair crest, κόρυς IG 12(2).129 ( Mytilene); ἱ. λόγοι, by comic metaph., Ar. Ra. 818.
letting horses loose, dub. l. in APl. 16.44 (fort. ἱππελάτης).
to be a-horsing, of mares, Arist. HA 572a10.
abounding in, swarming with horses (cf. καρπο-, ὑλο-, φυλλο-μανής) , λειμών S. Aj. 143 (anap.); variously expld. by Sch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἱππομανές, έος, τό, an Arcadian plant, thorn-apple, Datura stramonium, of which horses are madly fond, or which makes them mad, Theoc. 2.48; f.l. for -φαές in Thphr. HP 9.15.6.

children.label: b
children.definition: Dsc. 2.173; = ἀπόκυνον, Ps.- Dsc. 4.80.

small black fleshy substance on the forehead of a new-born foal, which, if procured before it was eaten off by the dam, was held to be a powerful φίλτρον, Arist. HA 577a9, 605a2, Thphr. Fr. 175, Ael. NA 3.17, 14.18.
mucous humour that runs from mares a-horsing, used for like purposes, Arist. HA 572a21, Paus. 5.27.3.
mad love for horses. Luc. Nigr. 29.
horse-fennel, Prangos ferulacea, Diocl. Fr. 155, Thphr. HP 6.1.4, Dsc. 3.71, Zopyr. ap. Orib. 14.64.1, etc.: sts. misspelt -μάραθρον in codd.
fight on horseback, Th. 4.124, X. Cyr. 6.4.18; ἱ. πρὸς ὁπλίτας to fight, cavalry against infantry, Id. Ages. 2.3.
horse-fight, action of cavalry, Th. 2.22, 4.72, Pl. La. 193b, etc.
of a horse-fight, νίκη St.Byz. s.v. Ἀλάβανδα.
fighting on horseback, trooper, Il. 10.431 (v.l. -δαμοι), Simon. 107.8 (= IG 7.53), Luc. Macr. 17, IG 9(1).871 (Corc., iii/ii B.C.).
horse-ruler, as a pr. n., A., etc. [In Th. 488, with the 2nd syll. long, metri gr.]
skilled in horses or in riding, Pi. I. 7(6).12.
partly a horse, half-horse half-man, Ael. VH 9.16.
horse-shaped, horse-like, Pl. Phdr. 253c.
horse-ant, dub. in Arist. HA 606a5.

children.label: II
children.definition: ant-cavalry, Luc. VH 1.12.
victorious in the chariot-race, Gloss., prob. l. in B. 13.22: freq.as pr. n.
horse-keeper, Gloss.
keeping horses, Poll. 1.181.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἱππόνομα, τά, prob. horse-hire, Hsch.
guiding or keeping horses, S. Aj. 232 (lyr., Pors. for ἱππονόμους), E. Hipp. 1399, Ar. Nu. 571 (lyr.).
have the concept or idea of a horse, opp. its real existence, Plu. Col. 2.1120d, 1121a; cf. ἀνθρωπόομαι.
with large cheeks, Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἱππόβοτον.
horse-fetter, Hippiatr. 106.

children.label: II
children.definition: figure-of-eight curve described by a planet, Simp. in Cael. 497.3, Procl. in Euc. pp. 127,128F.
saddlebags, Sen. Ep. 87.7.
horse-hoofed men, name of a fabulous tribe in Sarmatia, D.P. 310.
herding horses, of the Thracians, Il. 13.4, 14.227. (Cf. αἰ-πόλος, βου-κόλος.)

definition: ἵπποπορ, prob. corrupt for ἵππορ, Lacon. for ἵππος, Hsch.: ἱππόπορι· κοιλάς, αὐλή, δῶμα, Id.

children.definition: excessive prostitute, Ath. 13.565c, Alciphr. 1.38, al.; cf. ἵππος VII; also, one on horseback, Diog. ap. Eust. 1909.63.
hippopotamus, Dsc. 2.23, Gal. 14.241, Dam. Isid. 98:—also ἱππο-ποτάμις (for -ποτάμιος), ὁ, POxy. 1220.21 (iii A.D.).
horse-faced, epith. of the Moon-goddess, PMag.Par. 1.2549; of a fabulous tribe, Peripl.M.Rubr. 62.

horse, ἡ, mare, most freq. fem. in Poets; in full θήλεες ἵπποι Il. 5.269; ἵπποι θήλειαι 11.680, Od. 4.635; ἄρσενες ἵπποι 13.81, cf. Hdt. 3.86, Pl. Hp.Ma. 288b: pl., ἵπποι team of chariot-horses, Il. 16.370, al.: freq. in dual, 5.237, 8.41, al.: hence, of the chariot itself, ἀφʼ ἵπποιιν, ἀφʼ ἵππων, from the chariot, Il. 5.13, 19, al.; καθʼ ἵππων ἆλτο, ἐξ ἵππων βῆσε, ib. 111, 163; ἵππων ἐπιβησόμενος intending to mount his chariot, ib. 46; opp. πεζοί, πλῆτο δὲ πᾶν πεδίον πεζῶν τε καὶ ἵππων Od. 14.267, cf. 9.49; ἵπποι τε καὶ ἀνέρες Il. 2.554; λαός τε καὶ ἵπποι 18.153; of riders, νῶθʼ ἵππων ἐπιβάντες ἐθύνεον Hes. Sc. 286; freq. of race-horses, ἵ. ἀκαμαντόποδες Pi. O. 3.4; ἀελλόποδες Simon. 7; ἀθληταί Lys. 19.63: metaph., ἁλὸς ἵ., of ships, Od. 4.708, cf. Secund. Sent. 17.

data.quote: πεζοί, πλῆτο δὲ πᾶν πεδίον πεζῶν τε καὶ ἵππων

children.definition: Pegasus, Eudox. ap. Hipparch. 1.2.12, Ptol. Tetr. 27, Vett.Val. 12.11.
Porph. Abst. 4.16.
eculeus, Plu. Luc. 20 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἵππος, ἡ, horse, cavalry, ἡ τῶν Θεσσαλῶν ἵ. Hdt. 5.64, etc.: always in sg., even with numerals, ἵ. χιλίη a thousand horse, Id. 7.41; μυρίη ibid.; μυρία, τρισμυρία, A. Pers. 302, 315; ἡ διακοσία ἵ. Th. 1.62; ἵππον ἔχω εἰς χιλίαν X. Cyr. 4.6.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: a sea-fish, Antim. et Numen. ap. Ath. 7.304e; but ὁ ἵ. ὁ ποτάμιος the hippopotamus, Hdt. 2.71, Arist. HA 502a9; ὁ ἵ. τοῦ Νείλου Ach.Tat. 4.2.

children.label: IV
children.definition: lewd woman, Ael. NA 4.11.

children.label: b
children.definition: pudenda muliebria et virilia, Hsch.

children.label: V
children.definition: a complaint of the eyes, such that they are always winking, Gal. 16.611, al. (also in Hp., acc. to [ Gal.]19.436).

children.label: VII
children.definition: anything large or coarse, as in our horse-chestnut, horse-laugh, v. ἱππό-κρημνος, -λάπαθον, -μάραθον, -πορνος, -σέλινον, -τυφία, and cf. βου-. (From ἴκϝος, v. ἴκκος; cf. Skt. aśvas, Lat. equus: the ἴ- (in place of e-) and the aspirate are unexplained; the latter acc. to Gell. 2.3.2 was confined to Attic; cf. Λεύκ-ιππος, Γλαύκ-ιππος.)
one who leads a horse by the rein, Anacr. 75.6.
Alexanders, Smyrnium olusatrum, Thphr. HP 2.2.1, Arist. Pr. 923a34, Dsc. 3.67: metaph., γελᾶν ἱπποσέλινα Pherecr. 131.4.
with horseʼs legs, ἄνθρωπος Gal. UP 3.1.
inspector of horses, PPetr. 3pp. 157,158 (iii B.C.).
driving horses, ἄνδρες Pi. P. 2.65; Ἰόλαος Id. I. 5(4).32:—fem. ἱπποσόα, epith. of Artemis, Id. O. 3.26 (as Subst., Pae. 9.7):—also ἱπποσσόος, ον, Nonn. D. 37.320.

definition: ἱπποστάσιον [ ᾰ], τό, = sq., Lys. Fr. 56S.: pl., App. Pun. 95, Mith. 84:—also ἱππο-στᾰσία, ἡ, Hippiatr. 29.

children.definition: stable, Plb. 13.8.3, Ph. 2.307 (pl.), Poll. 1.184, Anon. Oxy. 1368.46: metaph., Ἀελίου κνεφαία ἱππόστασις the dark stable of the Sun, i.e. the West, E. Alc. 594 (lyr.); but Ἕω φαεννὰς Ἡλίου θʼ ἱπποστάσεις, of the East, Id. Fr. 771.5.

the art of driving the war-chariot: generally, driving, horsemanship, ἱπποσύνῃ . . πεποιθώς Il. 4.303, cf. 11.503; ἔξοχοι ἱπποσύνᾳ Simon. 108 ( = IG 1(2).946): in pl., λελασμένος ἱπποσυνάων Il. 16.776, Od. 24.40; ἱπποσύνας ἐδίδαξαν Il. 23.307.

children.label: II
children.definition: horse, cavalry, Orac. ap. Hdt. 7.141.
ἱππικός, Δαρδανία E. Or. 1392 (lyr.); unless ἱπποσύνα is Dor. gen. from nom. ἱπποσύνης, ὁ, cf. Sch., or ἱπποσύνᾳ be read.

definition: ἱππότα, ὁ, Ep. form of ἱππότης.

children.definition: horse-bull, Hld. 10.29.
maker of the Trojan horse, Lyc. 930.

driver or rider of horses, horseman, knight, Hdt. 7.55, 9.49, 69; in Hom. always in Ep. nom. ἱππότᾰ, as Γερήνιος ἱππότα Νέστωρ Il. 2.336, etc.; ἱππότης Κολωνός S. OC 59; ἱππότης on horseback, Luc. Tox. 47; τοὶ ἱππότη, Boeot. for οἱ ἱππεῖς, IG 7.3087 (Lebad.), cf. Ascl. Tact. 10.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., ἱππόται λαοί Pi. P. 4.153; ἱ. λεώς the horse, A. Th. 80 (lyr.); λεὼν ἄνιππον ἱ. τε S. OC 899; ἱ. ὄχλος E. Supp. 660; στρατός Plu. Aem. 9.—Never used in correct Att. Prose.
horse-nature, the concept of horse, Antisth. et Pl. ap. Simp. in Cat. 208.30, 32, Sch. Aristid. p.167F.
a large kind of tiger, D.C. 77.6; cf. ἵππος VII.
diarrhoea of horses, Hippiatr. 56.

definition: ἱππότις, ιδος, fem. of ἱππότης, Tryph. 670, Nonn. D. 1.172.

children.definition: horse-bearing, of Medusa, Nonn. D. 47.693.
the art of the ἱπποτοξότης, Tz. H. 6.996, 998.
mounted bowman horse-archer, Hdt. 9.49, 4.46; employed as police at Athens, Th. 2.13, Lys. 15.6: Com., ἱέρακας ἱ. Ar. Av. 1179.
horse-goat-stag, a fabulous monster: used of a cup made to represent it, Philem. 87.
place for horse-breeding, stud-stable, Str. 5.1.4, 16.2.10 ( -τρόφιον).

definition: ἱπποτροφέω, aor. -τρόφησα Paus. 3.8.1: pf. -τρόφηκα D.L. 8.51, ( καθ-) Is. 5.43; but ἱπποτετρόφηκα Lycurg. 139 codd.:—

children.definition: breed or keep horses, Lycurg. l.c., Isoc. 16.33, Hyp. Lyc. 16, Satyr. 1; ἱπποτροφοῦσα πόλις Aen.Tact. 26.4; feed horses, ποᾷ χλωρᾷ Dsc. 4.15 (v.l. πόαν χλωράν).

breeding or keeping of horses, esp. for racing, ἱ. γὰρ οὐ Ζακύνθῳ . . ὀπαδεῖ Simon. 15: freq. in pl., ἱπποτροφίας νομίζειν Pi. I. 2.38, cf. X. Oec. 2.6, Pl. Ly. 205c, Arist. Pol. 1289b35, Anon. Oxy. 664.27: sg., Th. 6.12, Plu. Ages. 20.
ἀτελὴς ἔσται . . -ίας SIG 1003.26 ( Priene, ii B.C.).
of or for horse-keeping: -κόν, τό, allowance made to ἱπποτρόφοι, PTheb.Bank 6.8 (ii B.C.).
horse-feeding, abounding in horses, of Thrace, Hes. Op. 507; of Argos, Pi. N. 10.41; πόλις B. 10.114.

children.label: II
children.definition: breeding and keeping race-horses, Pi. I. 4(3).32, etc.; μέγας καὶ λαμπρὸς ἱ. D. 18.320, cf. Plu. Them. 5, Paus. 6.2.1.
horsebreeder, POxy. 2110.6 (iv A.D.), Hippiatr. 34.
horse-pride, i.e. excessive pride or conceit, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 45, Pl. ap. D.L. 3.39.
horse-tail, Arat. 438.
Hices. ap. Ath. 7.304c.

definition: ἵππουρις, ιδος, ἡ, ( οὐρά) as fem. Adj.,

children.definition: horse-tailed, decked with a horse-tail, freq. in Hom. (esp. Il.), in nom. and acc. ἵππουρις, -ιν, κόρυς Il. 6.495; τρυφάλεια 19.382; κυνέη Od. 22.124.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., horse-tail, Ael. NA 16.21; Satyrʼs tail, Phryn. PS p.77B.
horse-tail, Equisetum silvaticum, Dsc. 4.46, Ps.-Democr. in Gp. 2.6.27; also, = Equisetum maximum, Dsc. 4.47.
a complaint in the groin, caused by constant riding, dub. in Hp. Epid. 7.122.
horse-tailed: as Subst.,
Coryphaena hippurus, Epich. 51, Arist. HA 543a23, Numen. ap. Ath. 7.304d, Opp. H. 1.184.
insect, Ael. NA 15.1.
Hippiatr. 27.
horse-eaters, name of a Scythian tribe, Ptol. Geog. 5.9.
spurge, Euphorbia spinosa, used for carding cloth, Asclep. ap. Gal. Nat.Fac. 1.13, Dsc. 4.159 (also ἱππόφαος ibid., ἱπποφανής Ps.- Dsc. ibid.).
= sq., Ps.- Dsc. 4.160; = ἱππόφεως, Gal. 19.106; as a drug, Thphr. HP 9.15.6.
Centaurea spinosa, Dsc. 4.160, Plin. HN 27.92, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.37.
spurge, Euphorbia acanthothamnos, gen. -φεω (v.l. -φαέως, -φέως) Hp. Int. 13, 25, 26; nom. -φεως Thphr. HP 6.5.2.
Plin. HN 26.55, Gloss.
giant φλόμος, i.e. belladonna, Atropa belladonna, Plin. HN 25.148.
horse-fear, a fabulous plant, Ps.-Democr. ap. Plin. HN 24.161.

definition: ἱπποφορβεύς, έως, ὁ, = ἱπποφορβός, Poll. 7.185:—fem. ἱπποφορβ-άς, άδος, Sch. Luc. Ind. 5:

children.definition: keep horses, Choerob. in Theod. 2lxxxv.
horse-keeping, Pl. Plt. 299d.
herd of horses, Hdt. 4.110, X. HG 4.6.6, Arist. HA 576a20.
horse-keeper, Pl. Plt. 261d, Arist. HA 577a15, Jul. Or. 7.227c: as Adj., ἱ. γῆ D.H. 1.37.
αὐλὸς ἱ. a flute used by ἱπποφορβοί, made of laurel bark, Poll. 4.74.

definition: ἱπποχάρμης, ου, ὁ, = ἱππιοχάρμης, Pi. O. 1.23, Pae. 2.104.
ἱππόχθων, ονος, dub. sens., Tab.Defix.Aud. 38.29 ( Alexandria, iii A.D.).

children.definition: horse-like, X. Eq. 1.11 ( Comp.), Poll. 1.192; κεφαλή Hippiatr. 14.
riding in a swift chariot, ἀέλιος B. 10.101.
place for horses:
stable, IG 1(2).336 (pl.), X. Eq. 4.2, Moschio ap. Ath. 5.207f, PCair.Zen. 193.5 (iii B.C.).
posting-house, station, X. Cyr. 8.6.17, Supp.Epigr. 2.481 ( Scythia, iii A.D.).
buy horses, X. Eq.Mag. 1.14, Eq. 11.13.
buying of horses, Xen. Eq.Mag. 1.12 (with v.l. ἱππωνεία, which is found in codd. of Eq. 1.1, 3.1), Poll. 1.182.

children.label: II
children.definition: tax on sale of horses, SIG 4 ( Cyzicus, vi B.C.).

definition: ἵπταμαι, = πέτομαι, Mosch. 3.43, Babr. 65.4, Jul. Or. 2.72a, etc.; censured by Luc. Sol. 7, Lex. 25.

children.definition: press hard, oppress, μέγα δʼ ἴψαο λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν Il. 1.454, 16.237; τάχα δʼ ἴψεται υἷας Ἀχαιῶν 2.193: generally, hurt, harm, σὺ τόνδε μηρὸν ἴψω; Theoc. Adon. 19, cf. Str. 8.6.7:— Act., ἴπτω, = βλάπτω, only in EM 481.3; ἶψαι, ἴψας, Hsch. (Perh. related to ἰάπτω (B) or to ἶπος.)
pressing hard, squeezing, esp. in reducing dislocations, Hp. Art. 47, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.27.5 and 32.7.
olive- or wine-press, ἰ. ληνοῦ, Gloss.; ὅλμοι καὶ ἰ. PRev.Laws 49.13, cf. 51.2 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: bougie, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.9.7, Antyll. ap. eund. 44.23.61, Meges ap.eund. 44.24.9.
Heracl.Tarent. ap. Gal. 13.725, Orib. Fr. 52.
for pressing in dislocated joints, σπάθη Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.32.4 and 17.9.
Il. 18.531; v. εἴρη.
ἰράνθεμον, τό, = ἠράνθεμον, Hippiatr. 44.

definition: ἱράομαι, Ion. for ἱεράομαι. ἱρέα, ἱρέη, ἱρεία, ἱρηΐη,

children.definition: ἴρερος, v.l. for εἴρερος. ἱρεύς, ἱρεύω, ἱρήϊον, Ion. and Ep. for ἱερ-.

definition: ἰρήν, ένος, ὁ, Ion. for εἰρήν, prob. in Hdt. 9.85.
ἴρηξ, ηκος, ὁ, Ion. and Ep. for ἱέραξ.

children.definition: priestess, Hsch.
to be iridescent, PHolm. 7.6.

definition: ἰρίνεος [ ῑρῐν], α, ον, = ἴρινος, Nic. Al. 203, 241.

children.definition: mixed with iris-oil, Philox. 2.40.
made from the iris, μύρον Pl.Com. 69.7, Cephisod. 3.2, Alex. 62.8, Thphr. HP 9.9.2, Plb. 30.26.2.
rainbow-like, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 19, Olymp. in Mete. 230.21, al.

definition: Ἶρις, ιδος, ἡ, acc. Ἶριν, voc. Ἶρι:—

children.definition: Iris, the messenger of the gods among themselves, Il. 8.398 (never in Od.), Hes. Th. 780, etc. (Perh. fr. Ϝῖρις, cf. ὠκέα Ἶρις Il. 2.786, al., Hes. l.c.; ὦκα δὲ Ἶρις Il. 23.198 (Pap.); possibly also fr. Ἐϝῖρις: Εἶρις is the name of a ship, IG 2(2).1611c137 (iv B.C.), but ἶρις is written in Michel 832 ( Samos, iv B.C.): allegorized as προφορικὸς λόγος and derived from εἴρω by Stoic. 2.43.)

children.label: II
children.definition: ἶρις, ἡ, gen. ἴριδος Thphr. CP 6.11.13, also εως Androm. ap. Gal. 14.43, POxy. 1088.34 (i A.D.), Gp. 6.8.1; acc. ἶριν Michel l.c., Plu. QConv. 2.664e, ἴριδα Nic. Al. 406; Ep. dat. pl. ἴρισσιν (v. infr.):— rainbow, δράκοντες . . , ἴρισσιν ἐοικότες, ἅς τε Κρονίων ἐν νέφεϊ στήριξε, τέρας μερόπων ἀνθρώπων Il. 11.27, cf. Arist. Mete. 375a1, Epicur. Ep. 2p.51U.

data.quote: δράκοντες . . , ἴρισσιν ἐοικότες, ἅς τε Κρονίων ἐν νέφεϊ στήριξε, τέρας μερόπων ἀνθρώπων

children.definition: bright-coloured circle surrounding another body, as the lunar rainbow, Arist. Mete. 375a18; halo of candle, Thphr. Sign. 13; round the eyes of a peacockʼs tail, Luc. Dom. 11; the iris of the eye, Ruf. Onom. 24, [ Gal.] 14.702; also, section through the ciliary region, Gal. UP 10.2.
iridescent garment, Michel l.c.

iris, e.g. the purple Iris, I. germanica or pallida, εὐάνθεμον ἶριν AP 4.1.9 ( Mel.); τὸ ἄνθος πολλὰς ἔχει ἐν αὑτῷ ποικιλίας Arist. Col. 796b26, cf. Plin. HN 21.40; also, the white variety of it, I. florentina, from the rhizome of which the orris-root of commerce is made, Thphr. HP 1.7.2, CP 6.11.13, etc.; ἶρις Ἰλλυρική Dsc. 1.1, cf. Plin. HN 13.14: in this sense some wrote it oxyt. ἰρίς, ίδος, Eust. 391.33, Sch. Nic. l.c.

data.quote: τὸ ἄνθος πολλὰς ἔχει ἐν αὑτῷ ποικιλίας

children.definition: Plin. HN 37.136.
like the rainbow, Arist. Mete. 374a28.
sack-bearer, Schwyzer 230 (vi B.C.).

definition: ἱρο-, Ion. and Ep. contr. for ἱερο-.
ἱρόν, τό, Ion. for ἱερόν: ἱροργίη, v. ἱερουργία.

children.definition: priest or priestess, IG 3.736, 5(2).461 (Megalop.).

definition: ἱρός, Ion. and Ep. for ἱερός, but also in Att. Poets,

children.definition: ἶρος, Aeol. for ἱερός.

Irus, a name given by the suitors to the Ithacan beggar Arnaeus because he carried messages (cf. Ἶρις), Od. 18.5 sq.: hence, later as Appellat., an Irus, i.e. a beggar, Lib. Or. 18.140: pl., Ἶροι Luc. Nav. 24.
of sacred earth, βῶλος IG 14.1389ii 27.
region, dub. word in Inscr.Cypr. 135.8,31 H. (where toironi may be τοῖ οἰρῶνι; v. οἰρών).
in sacred fashion, Anacr. 149.
priesthood, v.l. in Hdt. 4.161.

definition: ἴς (A) [ ῑ], ἡ, gen. ἰνός, acc. ἶνα, nom.pl. ἶνες, dat. ἴνεσι Il. 23.191, also ἰσίν Sor. (v. infr.), Suid. s.v. ἶνες, cj. Nauck for εἰσίν in A. Fr. 229:—

children.definition: sinew, tendon, sg. once in Hom., ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ἂν . . ἀνὴρ . . ἶνα τάμῃ διὰ πᾶσαν Il. 17.522: usu. in pl., sinews, οὐ γὰρ ἔτι σάρκας τε καὶ ὀστέα ἲνες ἔχουσιν Od. 11.219, cf. Il. 23.191; ἶνες ἄρθρων Ar. Pax 86, cf. Archil. 138; ἶνες αὐτὸ μόνον καὶ λεπτὴ δορά, of a person wasted by disease, Ph. 2.432; δοράς, σάρκας, ἶνας ib. 527: metaph., Τρωίας ἶνας ἐκταμὼν δορί Pi. I. 8(7).57.

data.quote: ὡς δʼ ὅτʼ ἂν . . ἀνὴρ . . ἶνα τάμῃ διὰ πᾶσαν
οὐ γὰρ ἔτι σάρκας τε καὶ ὀστέα ἲνες ἔχουσιν

children.definition: the fibrous vessels in the muscles, Pl. Ti. 84a, Arist. HA 515b27, al.; in blood, fibrine, Id. PA 650b14, cf. Pl. Ti. 82c, Meno Iatr. 17.34: metaph., of metals, Plu. Def.orac. 2.434b.
rib in the leaves of plants, Thphr. HP 3.12.7 (sg.).
strip of papyrus, ταῖς τῶν χαρτῶν ἰσίν Sor. 1.13: sg., Gal. 10.1000.

children.label: b
children.definition: λεπτὴ ἴς a small fibre of papyrus, Id. 17(1).795.

definition: ἴς (B) [ ῑ], ἡ, three times in acc. sg. ἶνα (elided ἶνʼ) Il. 5.245, 7.269, Od. 9.538, freq. in instr. ἶφι (q.v.), elsewh. only nom. sg.:—

children.definition: strength, force, of persons, ἀλλʼ ἄρα καὶ ἲς ἐσθλή Il. 12.320; ἐπέρεισε δὲ ἶνʼ ἀπέλεθρον 7.269; ἤ μοι ἔτʼ ἐστὶν ἴς, οἵη πάρος . . Od. 21.283, cf. 11.393, 18.3: freq. in periphr., ἱερὴ ἲς Τηλεμάχοιο the strong Telemachus, 2.409; κρατερὴ ἲς Ὀδυσῆος Il. 23.720; ἲς Ἡρακλῆος Hes. Th. 951; and in twofold periphr., ἲς βίης Ἡρακληείης ib. 332; also of things, ἲς ἀνέμου or ἀνέμοιο, Il. 15.383, 17.739, Od. 9.71; ἲς ποταμοῖο Il. 21.356; κράταιʼ ἴς was read by Ptol.Asc. in Od. 11.597; v. κρατύς. ( ϝῑ-, cf. γίς· ἰσχύς, Hsch., pr. n. ϝιφιάδας IG 7.3172.70, Lat. vis, vim; prob. cogn. with ἵεμαι but not with ἴς (A).)

data.quote: ἤ μοι ἔτʼ ἐστὶν ἴς, οἵη πάρος . .

children.definition: like an angel, Ev.Luc. 20.36, Hierocl. in CA 4p.425M.
like a brother, of Pylades, E. Or. 1015 (anap.); εὔνοια IPE 12.359.

definition: ἰσάζω:— Pass., fut. ἰσασθήσομαι Arist. EE 1243b31: aor. 1 ἰσάσθην Id. EN 1133a14: pf. ἴσασμαι ib. b5: ( ἴσος):—

children.definition: make equal, balance, of a person holding scales, σταθμὸν . . καὶ εἴριον . . ἀνέλκει ἰσάζουσʼ Il. 12.435; ἰ. τὰς κτήσεις to equalize them, Arist. Pol. 1265a38; ἰ. τὸ ἄνισον Id. EN 1132a7; τὴν φιλίαν ib. 1163b33:— Med., make oneself equal to another, οὕνεκʼ ἄρα Λητοῖ ἰσάσκετο (sc. Νιόβη) Il. 24.607:— Pass., to be made or to be equal, θεοῖς Pl. Ti. 41c: abs., Arist. EN 1133a14, al.; μήκει ποδὸς ἴχνος ἰσάζεται Nic. Th. 286; δίστιχα ψήφοισιν ἰσάζεται AP 9.356 ( Leon.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., to be equal, Pl. Lg. 773a, Arist. EN 1154b24; ἀλλήλοις Id. Pol. 1304a39.
to be even, normal, Hp. Morb. 4.49. [ ῑ in Hom.; ῐ in Nic. Th. 286, 886.]
equal to the Immortals, καρπός Arist. Fr. 675.7 as quoted by Did. in D. ( 6.37).
resemble, Nic. Al. 399, Fr. 74.56; to be made equal, Arat. 235, 513:— Act., ἰσαίω is implied in ἰσήι ( Boeot. for ἰσαίει) · ἰσοῖ, ἰσάζει, Hsch.

definition: ἰσαῖος [ ῑ], α, ον, late poet. form of ἴσος, Nic. Th. 360:— ἡ ἰσαία (sc. μοῖρα),

children.definition: equality, ἐπʼ ἰσαίῃ Call. Jov. 63, cf. Philostr.Jun. Im. 3; τὰ ἰσαῖα ( ἰσεα lapis) an equal share, SIG 57.10 ( Milet., v B.C.).

the same number of times, as many times, Str. 3.5.8; ἰ. πολλαπλάσιος c. gen., the same multiple of . . , Euc. 7 Def. 21, al.; ἰ. πολλαπλάσια equimultiples, Id. 5 Def. 5, al.; ἰ. ἴσος, of a number, equal multiplied by equal, i.e. square, Pl. R. 546c, Tht. 147e, 148a, Euc. 7 Def. 19, Ph. 1.11, etc.; ἰ. ἴσος ἰ. equal multiplied by equal multiplied by equal, i.e. cube number, Euc. 7 Def. 20, etc.
ranking with the Actian games, CIG 4472.11 (Laodicea ad Mare).
lasting an equal time, φύλλοις αἰγείρου S. Fr. 593.2.

ἴσᾱμι Theoc. 5.119; ἴσαις ( 2 sg.) Id. 14.34; ἴσᾱτι Id. 15.146; ἴσᾰτε Periand. ap. D.L. 1.99; ἴσαντι Theoc. 15.64; inf. γισάμεναι (i.e. ϝισ-) · εἰδέναι, Hsch.; Arc. ἰσάμεν ( ισμεν lapis), IG 5(2).357.12; 3 pl. subj. ἴσαντι Schwyzer 190 ( Cretan).
equal in the race: neut. pl. as Adv., ἰσάμιλλα δραμεῖν τινι AP 9.311 ( Phil.).
they went, 3 pl. impf. Ep. of εἶμι ( ibo), Hom.

children.label: II
children.definition: they knew, 3 pl. plpf. Ep. of οἶδα, Il. 18.405, Od. 4.772.
taking the same time to rise, ζῴδια Vett.Val. 142.27:—also ἰσ-ανάφορος, ον, ibid., cf. Paul.Al. E. 4, S. 2.
like a man, Hsch.
swift as the wind, E. IA 206 (lyr.).
of equal worth, Porph. Abst. 2.55; τῷ Διί Procl. in Cra. p.50 P.; τοῖς θεοῖς Iamb. Myst. 3.21; adequate, πρός τι Dam. Pr. 43, cf. 28. Adv. -ίως Iamb. Myst. 9.7.
worth its weight in silver, πορφυρᾶς ἰ. κηκῖδα A. Ag. 959, cf. Achae. 5, Ephipp. 21.4.
to be equal in number, τινι Tz. H. 1.939.
Μουσῶν IG 14.1747.

equal in number with, ψυχαὶ ἰ, τοῖς ἄστροις Pl. Ti. 41d, cf. Lg. 845a, Arist. EN 1156a7, al., Call. Del. 175, Puchstein Epigr.Gr. p.9; εἰσαρίθμοις ἔπεσι,= ἰσοψήφοις, IG 5(1).257 ( Laconia): poet. ἰσήριθμος, AP 6.84 ( Paul.Sil.), 328 ( Leon.), Lyc. 1258. Adv. ἰσάριθμως Gal. 19.469, Them. Or. 33.367b.

children.label: II
children.definition: of the same grammatical number, A.D. Synt. 170.13. Adv. -μως ib. 143.9.
equally ancient, Choerob. in Theod. 2.55.
equitable ruler, POxy. 41.12,28 (iii/iv A.D.).

definition: ἰσάσκετο [ῑ], Ep. 3 sg. impf. Med. of ἰσάζω, Il. 24.607.

children.definition: equalization, Epicur. Nat. 15.21 (pl.).
like a star, bright as a star, LXX 4 Ma. 17.5.
equalizing, handicapped, στάθμη, in a race, Eust. 1023.5.

definition: ἰσάτις, ιδος, Hp. Ulc. 11, Michel 832 ( Samos, iv B.C.) (but -ιος Hp. Aff. 38, -εως POxy. 101.12): ἡ:—

children.definition: woad, Lat. Isatis tinctoria, Hp. ll.cc., Thphr. Sens. 77, Dsc. 2.184, Plin. HN 20.59.
like woad, Hp. Epid. 4.45, 2.3.1; χολή Aret. CD 1.15.
of the same name, Theoc. Syrinx 9.
in the same number of ways, Arist. Metaph. 1013a16, al.; παρακολουθεῖν ἰ. τινί ib. 1054a14; τἀγαθὸν ἰ. λέγεται τῷ ὄντι in as many ways as, Id. EN 1096a23.

definition: Ἰσεῖα, τά, and Ἰσεῖον, τό, v. Ἰσιεῖα, Ἰσιεῖον.

children.definition: to be of an intermediate age, ἰσεννύουσαι Hp. Mul. 2.111 (so Gal. 19.106; ἴσαι νῦν ἐουσαι Hp. codd.; ἴσενοι ἐοῦσαι cj. Schneider (cf. ἔνος)).
Tim. Pers. 226.
speak as an equal, v.l. in LXX Si. 13.11:— Act. ἰσηγορ-έω, Sch.D Il. 1.187, Hsch., Phot.
equal right of speech, and generally, political equality, Hdt. 5.78, Eup. 291, X. Cyr. 1.3.10, Zeno Stoic. 1.54, Phld. Hom. p.20O., etc.; ἰ. καὶ ἐλευθερία D. 21.124; ἰ. καὶ παρρησία Jul. Or. 1.17b.
enjoying equal right of speech, freedom of speech, Poll. 6.174.
equal in magnitude, τάφρος Ph. Bel. 91.21; equal in age, Procl. in Prm. p.944S., al., Dam. Pr. 316.
of the same age with, τινι X. Smp. 8.1, Com.Adesp. 874: c. gen., ἰ. χρόνος κόσμου Ph. 1.6: abs., Id. 2.303.
equinox, ἰ. ἐαρινή, μετοπωρινή, ὀπωρινή, Arist. Mete. 364b1, 2, 371b30; φθινοπωρινή Id. HA 570b14, etc.: in pl., Hp. Aër. 11, Pl. Ax. 370c, Porph. Antr. 24.

equinoctial, ἀνατολή, δυσμή, Arist. Mete. 363a34, b1, cf. Str. 2.1.11; σκιά Hipparch. 1.3.6, cf. Str. 2.1.20; ζῴδιον Ptol. Tetr. 31; ὧραι standard hours (opp. καιρικός, q.v.), each = 1/24 of the νυχθήμερον, Hipparch. 1.1.10, Ptol. Alm. 2.9, Gal. 10.479, etc.; πυρὸς ἰ. wheat sown at that time, Thphr. CP 4.11.4; ὁ ἰ. κύκλος celestial equator, Arist. Mete. 345a3, Euc. Phaen. p.4M., Plu. Def.orac. 2.429f, etc.; ὁ ἰ. (sc. κύκλος), Hipparch. 1.10.22, Str. 1.1.21, etc.; ἁψίς Jul. Or. 5.168c; ἰ. χρόνοι time-degrees [each = 4 time-minutes] of the equator, Ptol. Alm. 1.16.
aequinoctium, Gloss.
aequidialis, Gloss. ἰσήμορτεν· ἀπέθανεν, Hsch.
with as many oars as, τινι E. IA 242 (lyr.).
ἴσος, ἰ. ψῆφοι E. IT 1472, cf. Nic. Th. 643 [ῑς]: c. dat., ῥαιβοῖσιν ἰσήρεες [ῐς] ib. 788.
know, imper. of οἶδα.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἴσθι, be, imper. of εἰμί.
ἰσθμαίνω, = ἀσθμαίνω, Hsch. (also ἰσμ-, Id.).

definition: Ἴσθμια, ων, τά, v. ἴσθμιον Iv.

children.label: II
children.definition: drink, Phot.

definition: Ἰσθμιακός, ή, όν, = Ἰσθμικός (q.v.): Ἰσθμιακά, τά,

children.definition: garlands, Ar. Fr. 491.
νίκα Pi. I. 8(7).3; αἱ Ἰ. σπονδαί Th. 8.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἡ Ἰ. (sc. ἑορτή) the Isthmian festival, Pl.Com. 46.10: pl., αἱ Ἰσθμιάδες,= τὰ Ἴσθμια, Pi. O. 13.33; a period of two years, between each celebration of the games, Apollod. 2.7.2.
spectator of the Isthmian games: Ἰσθμιασταί, οἱ, title of a play by Aeschylus.
of the Isthmus, ἀγών, σπονδαί, Str. 8.6.20, Paus. 5.2.1.
anything belonging to the neck or throat, necklace, Od. 18.300.
ἴσθμια, τά, pharynx, fauces, Hp. Dent. 21, Nic. Al. 191, 615, unless = παρίσθμια.

children.label: II
children.definition: neck of a bottle, ἴσθμιον ἀμφιφορῆος Poet. ap. Suid.; big-bellied bottle with a long neck, Cypr. word in Pamphil. ap. Ath. 11.472e; v. ἴσφνιον.
curb-stone of a well, Phot., Moer.
guard, Philet. ap. Ath. 15.677c.

children.label: III
children.definition: isthmus, Hsch.

conqueror in the Isthmian games, B. 9.26 (also Ἴσθμιο-νῑκος, ὁ, Id. 1.46): Ἰσθμιονῖκαι, οἱ, title of one book of Pindarʼs odes, A.D. Synt. 156.11, etc.

definition: Ἴσθμιος, α, ον, also ος, ον E. Tr. 1098 (lyr.):—

from the Isthmus, AP 9.588 ( Alc.).
on the Isthmus, AP 6.259 ( Phil.).

Ar. Fr. 14D.:—usu. on the Isthmus: at the Isthmian games, IG 1(2).77, Pi. O. 13.98, Lys. 19.63, Timocr. 1.10; also ἐν Ἰσθμοῖ Simon. 125 cod. [ Ἱσθ- IG 1(2).77, 829; Ἰθμοῖ SIG 36 A ( Delph., iv B.C.), but Ἰσθμοῖ ib. B ( Olymp., v B.C.); cf. Ἰσθμός.]

definition: ἰσθμός, οῦ, ὁ ( ἡ Inscr.Délos 353 A 29, 34 (iii B.C.), but ὁ 354.29, and v. infr. ΙΙ),

data.quote: ἰ. καὶ ὅρος τῆς τε κεφαλῆς καὶ τοῦ στήθεος

children.definition: pharynx, fauces, Gal. 18(2).961, Aret. SA 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: neck of land between two seas, isthmus, ὁ ἰ. τῆς Χερσονήσου Hdt. 6.36; of Athos, Id. 7.22; Κιμμερικός A. Pr. 729; ὁ ἰ. τῆς Παλλήνης Th. 1.56; ὁ Λευκαδίων ἰ. Id. 3.81.

Ἰσθμός (also Ἰθμός SIG 507 ( Delph., iii B.C.), cf. foreg.) ὁ ( ἡ in Pi., as O. 7.81, 8.48), the Isthmus of Corinth, Hdt. 8.40, etc.; Ἰσθμοῦ δειράς, αὐχὴν Ἰσθμοῦ, Pi. I. 1.9, B. 2.7; dat. Ἰσθμῷ prob. f.l. for Ἰσθμοῖ (q.v.) in Th. 5.18, AP 13.15; but ἐν Ἰσθμῷ correctly in Hdt. 9.27, 81.
narrow ridge, of the Caucasus, between Caspian and Euxine, Arist. Mu. 393b25, D.P. 20.
strait, narrow channel, Inscr.Délos Il.cc., App. Hann. 34. (Perh.fr. εἶμι ( ibo), cf. ἴθμα, εἰσ-ίθμη, and the spellings Ἰθμός (supr.), Ἰθμο-νίκα IG 4.951.10.)

definition: ἰσθμώδης, ες, = ἰσθμοειδής, Th. 7.26: Sup., Scymn. 926.

guild of worshippers of Isis, at Rhodes, IG 12(1).157,165 (i B.C.).

temple of Isis, Roussel Cultes Égyptiens 223 ( Delos, ii B.C.), Sammelb. 3926 (Ptolemais Hermiu, i B.C.):—also Ἰσιεῖον, τό, SIG 2588.230 ( Delos, ii B.C.); pl. Εἰσιεῖα, τά, festival of I., PCair.Zen. 154 (iii B.C.):—later Ἰσεῖον, τό, temple of I., Plu. Isid. 2.352a, prob. in AP 11.212 ( Lucill., pl.); pl. Ἰσεῖα, τά, festival of I., D.S. 1.14, 87.
sausage-maker, PStrassb. 46 (vi A.D.).

definition: ἰσικιομάγειρος [ ις], ὁ, = foreg., Wien.Stud. 24.129 (vi A.D.).
ἰσίκιον [ ῑσῐ], τό, or ἴσῐκος, ὁ,

warden of the temple of Isis, PCair.Zen. 172.14 (iii B.C.), BGU 993 (ii B.C.).

go, ἐνς πόλεμον Schwyzer 180 ( Crete).

guess, imagine, ἴσκεν ἕκαστος ἀνήρ Od. 22.31; suppose, c. acc. et inf., Simon. 130.

godlike, A. Pers. 634 (lyr.), Ariphron 1.4, Hierocl. in CA 4p.425M.

with equal cavities, αὐλός Plu. An.procr. 2.1021a, Theo Sm. p.60 H.(pl.).
equally high or eminent, πόλεις D.H. 3.9.
equally mixed, prob.l. (for -κρατεῖ) Hp. Morb. 2.42.
with equal horns, Nonn. D. 27.24.
equilibrium, equivalence, Gal. Hist.Phil. 126.
of Isocrates, λόγοι Phld. Rh. 1.100S.; ἀγωγή D.H. Isoc. 20:—also Ἰσοκρᾰτικός, ή, όν, Id. Vett.Cens. 3.3:
to be of equal force, S.E. M. 10.81.

of equal power, possessing equal rights with others, ἰσοκρατέες . . αἱ γυναῖκες τοῖσι ἀνδράσι Hdt. 4.26; ἰ. καὶ ὁμότιμοι Plu. Monarch. 2.827b: generally, evenly balanced, ἡ ἰσημερία ἐστὶ χειμὼν καὶ θέρος ἰσοκρατής Arist. Pr. 942b37; ἰ. οἶνος half-and-half, Hp. Morb. 2.42 (nisi leg. ἰσοκραής) ; ἐκ τῆς ἀμφοῖν -οῦς μίξεως Gal. 6.528; ἰ. κράσεις normal temperaments, Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.24.61. Adv. -τῶς, ἀπομάχεσθαι Ph. 1.198; with even balance, Zeno Stoic. 1.27, Iamb. in Nic. p.79 P.

data.quote: ἡ ἰσημερία ἐστὶ χειμὼν καὶ θέρος ἰσοκρατής

children.definition: equality of strength or power, Ti.Locr. 95c.
equality of rights, republic, opp. τυραννίς, Hdt. 5.92.αʹ (pl.).

definition: ἰσόκρατος, ον, = ἰσοκραής, Praxag. ap. Ruf. Onom. 226.

children.definition: equal to barley in price, Plb. 2.15.1.
made alike, Hsch., Phot.
sounding like, τινι Nonn. D. 27.92.
equally round, Philox. 2.10.
equality of members or clauses, Hermog. Id. 1.12 (pl.).
of equal members or clauses, Arist. Top. 148b33; τὸ ἰ. a sentence consisting of equal members, Demetr. Eloc. 25, Plu. Glor.Ath. 2.350e: in pl., D.S. 12.53, Ath. 5.187c.
formed of an equal number of strands, χορδαί Nicom. Harm. 6.

definition: ἰσολαχής, ές, = ἰσόμοιρος, cj. in Philol. 6.

children.definition: versus, antithetically composed, Diom. p.498 K.
with the same bed, Apollon. Lex.Hom.
speak freely with, τινι Sch. E. Hipp. 702.
ἰσηγορία, Plb. 30.31.16; -λογίαν ἔχειν πρός τινα Id. 24.10.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: counterbalancing arguments, S.E. M. 1.144.

definition: ἰσολόγχητος, ον, = ὁ τὰ ἴσα λαχών (cf. λόγχη), dub. in IG 9(1).309 ( Thronium).

children.definition: like those rendered to the Olympians, τιμαί Ph. 2.181, cf. 567.

children.label: II
children.definition: ranking with the Olympic games, [ ἀγὼν] γυμνικός SIG 630.13 ( Delph., ii B.C.), cf. IG 12(7).506.7 ( Nicuria), etc.
like the lyre, Sch. S. Tr. 643.

definition: ἰσομάτωρ [ᾱ], Dor. for ἰσο-μήτωρ, ὁ, ἡ,

children.definition: like oneʼs mother or dam, ἀμνός Theoc. 8.14; said to be Cret. by Hsch.
equal in the fight, D.H. 3.52; ἀρετή, κίνδυνος, D.S. 16.12, 17.83: τισι Ant.Lib. 14.2.
equal in size, X. Cyn. 5.29, Plb. 10.44.2, Phld. Mort. 3, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.8.2: c. dat., κύστις ἰ. ληκύθῳ Aen.Tact. 31.10; ἰ. γῇ Jul. Gal. 135c. Adv. -θως Aristid.Quint. 3.6.
equality, ἐξ -μερίας Sammelb. 6266.17 (vi A.D.).
equally divided, δόσεις BGU 1122.12 (i B.C.); of equal length, ib. 393.12 (ii A.D.): generally, equal, κέρδος Just. Nov. 97.1.
of equal measure or weight, εἰκών Pl. Phdr. 235d, Plu. Sol. 25; τινι D.C. 59.11, cf. Max.Tyr. 31.2.
equality of measure, Arist. Fr. 47.

ἰσομέτρητος, Ephipp. 14.9, Palaeph. 30; λίθοι, prob. in IG 2(2).463.46; σφηνίσκος Sever. ap. Aët. 7.92: c. dat., ἰ. τῇ προτέρᾳ δοῦναι προῖκα Just. Nov. 97.5; of equal perimeter, περὶ ἰ. σχημάτων, title of work by Zenodorus; in the same latitude, Nech. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.149: Subst., ἰσόμετρον, τό, life-size statue, τινος BCH 48.484 ( Delos, iv B.C.).
with equal forehead or front, X. HG 4.5.16.
equal in length, Arist. HA 506b14; τῇ Ἀττικῇ Str. 9.2.1; of numbers, having a common factor, Pl. R. 546c.
of Milesian fashion, ἱμάτιον D.S. 12.21.
have an equal share, Th. 6.39, X. Cyr. 2.3.17; τινος of a thing, D. 48.19; τινὸς πρός τινα Th. 6.16; πρὸς ἀλλήλους Isoc. 5.39; τινός τινι Is. 1.2, D.H. 6.66.

children.label: II
children.definition: occupy the same degree, Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(1).219.
equal share, κακοῖσιν ἐσθλοὺς ἰσομοιρίαν [ῑσ-] ἔχειν Sol. ap. Arist. Ath. 12.3; τινος in a thing, Th. 7.75.
Nymphod. 21, D.C. 52.4.
equability, of climate, Hp. Aër. 12; τῶν κράσεων Gal. 1.534.
equivalence of degree, Vett.Val. 139.16.
of equivalent positions, κανονογραφία Vett.Val. 336.11.

definition: ἰσόμοιρος, ον, Cret. ϝισϝό- Leg.Gort. 10.53, GDI 4974 (Gort.): ( μοῖρα)

children.definition: sharing equally or alike, c. gen. rei, πάντων X. Cyr. 4.6.12, etc.; τῶν ἄλλων ἰ. ἔστω SIG 1044.40 ( Halic., iv B.C.); γῆς ἰσόμοιρʼ ἀήρ air that sharest earth equally [with light], S. El. 87 (anap.): c. dat., τιμαῖς ἰσόμοιρον ἔθηκεν τὰν ὁμόλεκτρον ἥρωσιν IG 12(3).1190.3 ( Melos); ἰσόμοιρον, τό, equal portion, Nic. Th. 592: abs., ἰσόμοιρα . . ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ φῶς καὶ σκότος D.L. 8.26. Adv. -ρως Eust. 161.20.

data.quote: τιμαῖς ἰσόμοιρον ἔθηκεν τὰν ὁμόλεκτρον ἥρωσιν
ἰσόμοιρα . . ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ φῶς καὶ σκότος

children.definition: equivalent, corresponding, c. dat., κίβισιν, βάκτρῳ ἅρπην ἰσόμοιρον AJA 9.320 ( Sinope).
occupying the same degree, αἱ κατʼ ἰσόμοιρον στάσεις Vett.Val. 70.31, cf. Man. 4.194; τὴν Ἀφροδίτην ἰσόμοιρον οὖσαν ἡλίῳ Procl. Hyp. 1.21. Adv. -ρως Cat.Cod.Astr. 5(1).219.

definition: ἰσόμορος, ον, = ἰσόμοιρος, used by Poseidon of himself in relation to Zeus, Il. 15.209: generally,

children.definition: like, τινι AP 6.206 ( Antip.Sid.); ἰσόμορον, τό, equal portion, Nic. Th. 105, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.41. [ ῑσ- ll. cc.]
dream-like, empty, A. Pr. 549 (lyr.) [perh. ῑ].
dying equally or alike, E. Or. 200 (lyr.), ubi v. Sch.
ranking with the Nemean games, ἀγών SIG 402.10, al. ( Delph., iii B.C.), IG 2(2).680.17 (prob.):—also ἰσο-νέμειος Klio 14.275 ( Delph., iii B.C.).
have equal rights, μετά τινος Th. 6.38.
equal distribution, equilibrium, balance, δυνάμεων Alcmaeon 4, cf. Ti.Locr. 99b, Epicur. Fr. 352.

children.label: II
children.definition: equality of political rights, Hdt. 3.80, 142; ἰ. ποιεῖν Id. 5.37; opp. δυναστεία, Th. 4.78; ἰ. πολιτική Id. 3.82; ἰ. ἐν γυναιξὶ πρὸς ἄνδρας καὶ ἀνδράσι πρὸς γυναῖκας Pl. R. 563b.

data.quote: ἰ. ἐν γυναιξὶ πρὸς ἄνδρας καὶ ἀνδράσι πρὸς γυναῖκας

children.definition: devoted to equality, ἀνήρ Pl. R. 561e.

where all have equal rights, ἰσονόμους τʼ Ἀθήνας ἐποιησάτην Scol. 12; ὀλιγαρχία ἰ. Th. 3.62; δίκαιος καὶ ἰ. πολιτεία Pl. Ep. 326d; ἐν ἰσονόμῳ πολιτεύειν App. BC 1.15; ζῷον ἰ. θεῷ M.Ant. 8.2; Γαλατία ἰ. enjoying full citizen rights, of Gallia Cisalpina, Nic.Dam. 130.28J.

children.label: II
children.definition: χαλκὸς ἰ. copper at par (24 obols = 1 stater), opp. χαλκὸς οὗ διαλλαγή (copper at a discount), UPZ 112v19 (ii B.C.), PTeb. 99.4 (ii B.C.), PPetr. 3p.193, al. (ii B.C.).
equinox, Gloss.:— Adj. ἰσο-νύκτιος, ον, equinoctial, Gal. 16.407.
Hsch. (Celtic word, cf. Welsh ehawc, eog ‘salmon’, Lat. esox.)
like wood, Hsch. s.v. ὄξυλον.
of equal bulk or volume, Simp. in Cael. 691.35, in Ph. 1016.23.
like a child, as of a child, ἰσχύς A. Ag. 75 (lyr.).
a span long, AP 6.287 ( Antip.). [ ῑ . . ᾰ]
equal in the struggle, well-matched, μαχομένων . . καὶ γενομένων ἰσοπαλέων Hdt. 1.82, cf. 5.49; evenly balanced, μάχη Ctes. Fr. 29.31.
equivalent, equal, ἰ. πάντῃ Parm. 8.44; ἰ. κίνδυνοι Th. 2.39; πλήθει ἰ. τισί Id. 4.94; οὔτι ὥριφος ἰ. τοι Theoc. 5.30; ἰ. ἤματι νύξ AP 9.384.18, cf. Orph. A. 1014. Adv. -λῶς Sch. Arat. 364.

definition: ἰσόπαλος, ον, = foreg., Luc. Nav. 36, D.C. 40.42, Poll. 3.149, 5.157, Hsch.; prob. in Ibyc. 14, X. Ages. 2.9.

children.definition: of equal or even thickness or density, Arist. HA 527a7, Thphr. HP 3.5.6, Dsc. 5.90, Gal. 10.431, Nicom. Harm. 6:—late nom. sg. ἰσό-πᾰχυς Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 8.4.3 codd.
level ground, a flat, Il. 13.142, X. Cyr. 3.1.5; φυλάττειν ἐπὶ τοῦ ἰσοπέδου ἑαυτήν Luc. Im. 21.
of even surface, level, ἐξ ἰ. χωρίου Hp. VC 11, cf. Luc. Hipp. 4; ἰ. τῷ δέρματι Gal. 10.1011; ἰ. χρώματα flat in appearance, opp. κοῖλα, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.49.
level or even with, χοῦν ποιέων τῆ ἄλλῃ γῇ ἰσόπεδον Hdt. 4.201, cf. D.S. 19.94, Plu. Num. 10.

data.quote: χοῦν ποιέων τῆ ἄλλῃ γῇ ἰσόπεδον

children.definition: of the same number of πλέθρα, Hsch.
in equal distress, Sch. A. Eu. 783.
equally bounded, Sch. Od. 1.98.
of equal perimeter, Damian. Opt. 3, Hero *Deff. 82, Procl. in Ti. 2.71 D., al.
of the length of a cubit, Philostr. Gym. 12, Opp. H. 1.213.
Hsch.
equal in breadth, Arist. Oec. 1345a33, Archimel. ap. Ath. 5.209c; ἄρτος ἰ. Hippoloch. ap. Ath. 4.128d ( -πλατυς codd.): c. dat., ἰ. τῷ τείχει Th. 3.21.
a second Plato, AP 11.354. [ ῑ . . ᾰ]
with equal sides, πλαίσιον X. An. 3.4.19, etc.: freq. in Geom., equilateral, τρίγωνον Pl. Ti. 54a, 54e; ἐπίπεδον ib. 55e; τετράγωνον Plb. 6.31.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: square, opp. ἑτερομήκης, Pl. Tht. 148a, Arist. APo. 73a40. Adv. -πλεύρως Nicom. Ar. 2.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hermog. Inv. 4.3.
struck in the same way, χορδή Porph. in Harm. p.296W.

equal in number or quantity, ἠήρ Hp. Morb. 2.4; ἱππεῖς X. Ages. 2.9: Math., equal in number, Euc. 12.4, al.; σχήματα τὰς πλευρὰς ἰ. ἔχοντα Papp. 332.14: c. dat., τινι to a person or thing, Th. 6.37, D.C. 50.33; ἰ. θαλάσσῃ ποταμοί Poll. 3.103. Adv. -θῶς Euc. 12.5.
having an equal number of sides, εὐθύγραμμα, σχήματα, Anon.Geom. in Papp. 1142.21.

equality of civic rights, Arist. Fr. 575; granted to individuals, IG 7.4264 ( Oropus, iii B.C.), 5(2).11 ( Tegea, iii B.C.), etc.; or to communities, SIG 472.11 ( Phigalea, iii B.C.), Plb. 16.26.9, D.S. 15.46, etc.
reciprocity of such rights (guaranteed by treaty between two states), GDI 5040 ( Crete), OGI 265 ( Pergam., iii B.C.), etc.; Λεβαδεῦσίν ἐστιν ἰ. πρὸς Ἀρκάδας Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.300b.
enjoying equal political rights, τινὰς τοῖς Μακεδόσιν ποιήσας ἰ. J. AJ 12.1.1, cf. LXX 3 Ma. 2.30, GDI 5183.25 ( Crete), Inscr.Magn. 34.28, al., IPE 12.357.
enjoying reciprocity of rights, of the citizens of Roman municipia, D.H. 8.76:—fem. ἰσοπολῖτις, ίτιδος, of cities enjoying such rights, αἱ ἰ. πόλεις,= municipia, App. BC 1.10.
equitable citizen, POxy. 41.28 (iii/iv A.D.).
a faring equally, like condition, Eust. 662.35.
like an old man, A. Ag. 78 (anap.).
wedding-gift of bridegroom to bride, CPR 30ii10 (vi A.D.), etc.
as good as given away, Hsch. s.v. ἀντίπροικα.
enjoying the privileges of a πρόξενος, Schwyzer 415.3 ( Olymp.).
A. Ag. 276:—also ἰσόπτεροι· ἰσότιμοι, Hsch.
with similar folds, χιτώνιον IG 2(2).1518.82,84.
with like cases, A.D. Pron. 90.6.
ranking with the Pythian games, ἀγών SIG 402.24 ( Delph., iii B.C.), prob. in IG 2(2).680.16; στέφανος SIG 557.29 ( Magn. Mae.); ἱερὰ Αὐγουστεῖα ἰ. IGRom. 4.1265 ( Thyatira).
equally condensed (by tension), χορδή Porph. in Harm. p.296W. (comment on πυκνοτέρας in Ptol. Harm. 1.8).
Hsch.
fumitory, Fumaria capreolata, Dsc. 4.120, Plin. HN 27.94, Gal. 11.891.
reckoned as of equal value with wheat, λωτός, κρότων, PLond.ined. 2360.

definition: ἰσορρεπής, ές, = ἰσόρροπος, Nic. Th. 646, Poet. de herb. 98.

children.definition: to be equally balanced, in equipoise, Pl. Ti. 52e, Lg. 733c, 794e; τινι with . . , Plb. 1.11.1.
equipoise, equilibrium, Hero Spir. 1.1.
equipoise, equilibrium, Pl. Phd. 109a: metaph., ἰ. τοῦ χρόνου Agath. 4.25.
work on equilibrium by Archimedes.
in equipoise, of the balance, Pl. Phd. 109a, Plt. 270a ( Sup.), etc.; τάλαντα βρίσας οὐκ ἰσορρόπῳ τύχῃ A. Pers. 346; ἰσορρόπου τοῦ πήχεως (sc. τοῦ ζυγοῦ) γινομένου IG 2(2).1013.34.

well-balanced, well-matched, ἰ. αὐτὸς ἑαυτῷ of a man with his legs of the same length, Hp. Fract. 19; of a nose, flattened, but not awry, Id. Art. 37; of a bone, cylindrical, ib. 34; δέρμα ἰ., opp. περιρρεπής, ib. 50; ἰ. ἀγών evenly balanced, E. Supp. 706; μάχη Th. 1.105; δυνάμεις Pl. Ti. 52e; βίος Id. Lg. 733c; τιμή Arist. EN 1164b4: c. dat., τὸ γένος τὸ Ἀττικὸν ἰ. τῷ ἑωυτῶν ἂν γίνοιτο would become a match for their own, Hdt. 5.91; ἰ. Ῥωμαίοις Hdn. 6.7.8; ἰ. καταστῆναί τινι IPE 12.40.18 ( Olbia, ii A.D.); ἰ. ὁ λόγος τῶν ἔργων in precise equipoise with . . , Th. 2.42; ἰ. πρός τι Hdn. 6.3.2.
of equal weight, χρυσίον Inscr.Délos 313a.45 ( iii B.C., -ορο-).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -όπως, ἀφιέναι Hp. Art. 43; πορεύεσθαι Pl. Phdr. 247b; ἀγωνίσασθαι D.C. 41.61: neut. pl. ἰσόρροπα as Adv., Tim. Pers. 47.
of like form, Pi. Pae.Fr. 90.

definition: ἴσος, η, ον, Ep. ἶσος and ἔϊσος (v. infr.); Cret., Arc. ϝίσϝος GDI 4998ii2, 4982.2, Schwyzer 665, cf. γισγόν· ἴσον, Hsch.; later ἵσος Schwyzer 708a (1) ( Ephesus, iv B.C.), Tab.Heracl. 1.175, etc.:—

children.definition: equal in size, strength, or number, c. dat., κύματα ἶσα ὄρεσσιν Od. 3.290, etc.; freq. of appearance, like, ἶσος ἀναύδῳ 10.378; ἶσος Ἄρευι Sapph. 91 (dub.); ἴσος θεοῖσιν Ead.2.1: freq.abs., ἴσην . . βίην καὶ κῦδος Il. 7.205; ἶσον θυμὸν ἔχειν to be of like mind, 13.704, 17.720: neut. as Adv., ἶσον ἐμοὶ φρονέουσα 15.50; θεοῖσιν ἶσʼ ἔθελε φρονέειν 5.441, cf. 21.315, etc.; ἴσος τινὶ τὸ μέγαθος, ὕψος, Hdt. 2.32, 124; τὸ μῆκος, τὸ πλάτος, X. An. 5.4.32; ἀριθμόν E. Supp. 662; ἴσα τὸν ἀ. Pl. R. 441c; ποτὴν ἴσον equal in flight of song, Alex.Aet. 5.5; ἴσον, τό, copy of a document, PLond. 3.1222.5 (ii A.D.), etc.: with dat. pers. in place of an object of comparison, οὐ μὲν σοί ποτε ἶσον ἔχω γέρας (i.e. τῷ σῷ γέραϊ) Il. 1.163; τοῖσδʼ ἴσας ναῦς (i.e. ταῖς τῶνδε) E. IA 262 (lyr.); ἴσα τοῖς νῦν στρατηγοῖς ἀγάθʼ εἰργασμένους D. 13.21: folld. by a relative word, ἐμοὶ ἴσον . . , ὅσονπερ ὑμῖν the same to me as to you, Ar. Ec. 173; τὰ ἐκεῖ ἴσα, ὥσπερ τὰ ἐνθάδε Lys. 19.36 codd. (fort. σᾶ) ; τὰ ἴσα ὅσαπερ . . Lex ap. D. 23.44; ἴσον . . ὅπερ Pl. Erx. 405b.

data.quote: ἴσα τοῖς νῦν στρατηγοῖς ἀγάθʼ εἰργασμένους
τὰ ἐκεῖ ἴσα, ὥσπερ τὰ ἐνθάδε

children.definition: ἴσα πρὸς ἴσα tit for tat, Hdt. 1.2; ταχθέντες ἴσοι πρὸς ἴσους S. Ant. 142 (anap.); ἴσους ἴσοισι . . ἀντιθείς E. Ph. 750; ἴσα ἀντὶ ἴσων λαμβάνειν, ἐκδοῦναι Pl. Lg. 774c; ἴσος ἴσῳ (sc. οἶνος ὕδατι) Cratin. 184, Com.Adesp. 107, etc.; κύλικος ἴσον ἴσῳ κεκραμένης (where ἴσον is adverbial) Ar. Pl. 1132; διδόναι γάλα καὶ οἶνον πίνειν ἴσον ἴσῳ Hp. Epid. 2.5.1: metaph., ‘fairly blended’, μηδὲν ἴσον ἴσῳ φέρων Ar. Ach. 354.

data.quote: διδόναι γάλα καὶ οἶνον πίνειν ἴσον ἴσῳ

children.definition: equal in rights, βούλεται ἡ πόλις ἐξ ἴσων εἶναι καὶ ὁμοίων Arist. Pol. 1295b25; ἡ πολιτικὴ ἐλευθέρων καὶ ἴσων ἀρχή ib. 1255b20; τὸ κατʼ ἀξίαν ἴ. ib. 1307a26, al.

data.quote: βούλεται ἡ πόλις ἐξ ἴσων εἶναι καὶ ὁμοίων

children.label: II
children.definition: equally divided or distributed, ἴση μοῖρα Il. 9.318; ἴση alone, oneʼs equal share, μή τίς μοι ἀτεμβόμενος κίοι ἴσης Od. 9.42 ( ἴσσης cj. Fick, cf. ἴσσασθαι) ; τὴν ἴ. ἔχων Cratin. 250; οὐ μὴν ἴ. ἔτεισεν (sc. τίσιν) S. OT 810; ἄχρι τῆς ἴ. up to the point of equality, D. 5.17: neut., μὴ ἴσον νεῖμαι ἑκατέρῳ Pl. Prt. 337a; οὐ μόνον ἴσον, ἀλλὰ καὶ πλέον ἔχειν Isoc. 17.57; οὐκ ἀνέξῃ δωμάτων ἔχων ἴσον καὶ τῷδε νεῖμαι; E. Ph. 547; τὰ ἴσα fair measure, τὰ ἴ. νέμειν Hdt. 6.11; μὴ ἴσων ἕκαστον τυγχάνειν ἀλλὰ πλεονεκτεῖν, X. Cyr. 2.2.20; προστυχεῖν τῶν ἴ. to obtain fair terms, S. Ph. 552; κἂν ἴσαι (sc. ψῆφοι) γένωνται equally divided, Ar. Ra. 685.

data.quote: μή τίς μοι ἀτεμβόμενος κίοι ἴσης
οὐ μόνον ἴσον, ἀλλὰ καὶ πλέον ἔχειν

children.definition: based on equality of rights, ἴ. καὶ ἔννομος πολιτεία Aeschin. 1.5; τὴν πολιτείαν ἰσαιτέραν καθιστάναι Th. 8.89; τὰ ἴ. equal rights, equality, freq. joined with τὰ ὅμοια or τὰ δίκαια, ὡς τῆς πολιτείας ἐσομένης ἐν τοῖς ἴ. καὶ ὁμοίοις X. HG 7.1.45; τῶν ἴ. καὶ τῶν δικαίων ἕκαστος ἡγεῖται ἑαυτῷ μετεῖναι ἐν τῇ δημοκρατίᾳ D. 21.67; οὐ μέτεστι τῶν ἴ. οὐδὲ τῶν ὁμοίων πρὸς τοὺς πλουσίους τοῖς λοιποῖς ib. 112; τῶν ἴ. μετεῖχε τοῖς ἄλλοις ib. 96; also ἡ ἴ. καὶ ὁμοία (sc. δίκη) , τῆς ἴ. καὶ ὁμοίας μετέχειν Th. 4.105; ἐπʼ ἴ. τε καὶ ὁμοίῃ on fair and equal terms, Hdt. 9.7.αʹ, cf. Th. 1.145; ἐπὶ τῇ ἴ. καὶ ὁμοίᾳ ib. 27, cf. SIG 312.27 ( Samos, iv B.C.), OGI 229.44 ( Smyrna, iii B.C.), etc.: generally, just, fair, ἐκ ποίας ἴ. καὶ δικαίας προφάσεως; D. 18.284.

data.quote: τὰ δίκαια, ὡς τῆς πολιτείας ἐσομένης ἐν τοῖς ἴ. καὶ ὁμοίοις
τῶν ἴ. καὶ τῶν δικαίων ἕκαστος ἡγεῖται ἑαυτῷ μετεῖναι ἐν τῇ δημοκρατίᾳ

children.definition: fair, impartial, S. Ph. 684 (lyr.), OT 677; ἴ. δικαστής Pl. Lg. 957c; ἴ. καὶ κοινοὶ ἀκροαταί D. 29.1, cf. 18.7; ἴ. καὶ κοινὸν δικαστήριον Id. 7.36; κοινοὺς μὲν . . , ἴ. δὲ μή Pl. Prt. 337a; ἴ. ἴσθι κρινων Men. Mon. 266, cf. 257; κριταὶ ἴ. καὶ δίκαιοι Plb. 24.15.3, etc.
adequate, ἡ ἴ. φρουρά Th. 7.27 (expld. by Sch. as regular, τεταγμένη) ; ἴσος τοῖς παροῦσι Id. 1.132.

children.label: III
children.definition: even, flat, εἰς τὸ ἴ. καταβαίνειν, of an army, X. An. 4.6.18 (but ἐν ἴσῳ προσιέναι to advance with even step, ib. 1.8.11); λέουσιν εἰς τὸ ἴ. καθιστάμενοι μάχεσθαι, opp. μετὰ πλεονεξίας ἀγωνίζεσθαι, on even terms, Id. Cyr. 1.6.28; ἴ. τοῖχος, opp. κεκλικώς, perpendicular, Phlp. in APo. 2.27.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Adv. ἴσως (v. sub voc.): but also,

Hom. downwds. (v. sub init.), ἶσον . . ἀπήχθετο κηρὶ μελαίνῃ even as Death, Il. 3.454; ἶσον ἐμοὶ βασίυε be king like me, 9.616; ἶσον γάρ σε θεῷ τίσουσιν Ἀχαιοί ib. 603; ἶσον ἐμῇ κεφαλῇ 18.82; τὸν . . ἶσα θεῷ . . εἰσορόωσιν Od. 15.520; ἶσα φίλοισι τέκεσσι Il. 5.71, cf. 13.176, Od. 1.432, 11.304, etc.: later abs., alike, δείλαιε τοῦ νοῦ τῆς τε συμφορᾶς ἴσον S. OT 1347; τὴν Σάμον καὶ Ἡρακλέας στήλας ἴσον ἀπέχειν Hdt. 8.132: c. dat., ἴσον ναοῖς θεῶν E. Hel. 801; ἴσον ἄπεσμεν τῷ πρίν equally as before, Id. Hipp. 302 (v.l. τῶν πρίν) ; ἴσα τοῖς πάνυ D.C. Fr. 70.6; ἴσα καί . . like as, as if, S. OT 1187 (lyr.), E. El. 994 (anap.), Th. 3.14; ἴσον ὡς . . E. Ion 1363; ὥσπερ . . S. El. 532; ὥστε . . E. Or. 882; ἅτε . . Id. HF 667 (lyr.); ὅσονπερ . . D. 15.1.

data.quote: δείλαιε τοῦ νοῦ τῆς τε συμφορᾶς ἴσον
τὴν Σάμον καὶ Ἡρακλέας στήλας ἴσον ἀπέχειν

children.definition: ἀπὸ τῆς ἴσης equally, Th. 1.15; ὁ ἀπὸ τῆς ἴ. ἐχθρός Id. 3.40; ἀπʼ ἴσης εἶναι D. 14.6; ἀφʼ ἵσου SIG 426.14 ( Teos, iii B.C.); διʼ ἴσου D.C. 43.37; at equal distance, Pl. R. 617b: also in Math., ex aequali, of proportions, Euc. 5 Def. 17, al.; διʼ ἴ. ἐν τεταραγμένῃ ἀναλογίᾳ ex aequali in disturbed proportion, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 2.4, al., Papp. 932.11; ἐν ἴσῳ equally, Th. 2.53, 4.65; ἐν ἴσῳ ἐστί it matters not, E. IA 1199; ἐν ἴσῳ [ἐστὶ] καὶ εἰ . . Th. 2.60; ἐν τῷ ἴσῳ εἶναι Id. 4.10; ἐξ ἴσης Pl. Lg. 861a: more freq. ἐξ ἴσου Hdt. 7.135, S. OT 563, etc.; ἐξ ἴ. τινί Id. Ant. 516, 644, Antipho 5.1, Pl. Grg. 517a; evenly, εὐθεῖα γραμμή ἐστιν ἥτις ἐξ ἴ. τοῖς ἐφʼ ἑαυτῆς σημείοις κεῖται Euc. 1 Def. 4; ἐξ ἴ. καὶ . . S. OC 254; ὡς . . Id. OT 61; οἱ ἐξ ἴ. persons of equal station, Pl. Lg. 777d, cf. 919d; ὁ ἐξ ἴ. κίνδυνος Plb. 9.4.4; ἐκ τοῦ ἴ. γίγνεσθαί τινι Th. 2.3; τοῖς ἐκ τοῦ ἴσου ἡμῖν οὖσι X. Hier. 8.5; ἐξ ἴσου τισὶ τῆς πολιτείας μεταδιδόναι Lys. 25.3; ἐκ τοῦ ἴ. μάχεσθαι to be evenly matched, X. HG 2.4.16; ἐξ ἴ. πολεμεῖν D. 8.47; κατὰ μῆνα τὸ αἱροῦν ἐξ ἴ. the sum due in equal monthly instalments, PAmh. 2.92.14, etc.; ἐπὶ or ἐπʼ ἴσης, ἐπὶ ἴ. διαφέρειν τὸν πόλεμον Hdt. 1.74; τοῦτο ἐπʼ ἴσης ἔχει Id. 7.50, cf. S. El. 1062 (lyr.), etc.; ἐπʼ ἴσου Plb. 1.18.10; ἐπʼ ἴσον Id. 6.38.4, cf. Docum. ap. D. 18.106, Phld. Ir. p.21 W.; ἐπὶ ἶσα μάχη τέτατο Il. 12.436; cf. κατὰ ἶσα μάχην ἐτάνυσσε 11.336; κατʼ ἴσον Dsc. 1.68.6, Gal. UP 1.19; μετʼ ἴσου equally, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 124.12.

data.quote: εὐθεῖα γραμμή ἐστιν ἥτις ἐξ ἴ. τοῖς ἐφʼ ἑαυτῆς σημείοις κεῖται
τοῖς ἐκ τοῦ ἴσου ἡμῖν οὖσι
ἐξ ἴσου τισὶ τῆς πολιτείας μεταδιδόναι
ἐπʼ ἴσης, ἐπὶ ἴ. διαφέρειν τὸν πόλεμον

children.label: V
children.definition: Comp. ἰσαίτερος E. Supp. 441, Th. 8.89, X. HG 7.1.14: Sup. ἰσότατος Timo 68 (fr. 842 Supp. Hell.); ἰσαίτατος Ph. 1.462. Adv. ὡς ἰσαίτατα Pl. Lg. 744c, but ὡς ἰσότατα SIG 531.30 ( Dyme). [ ῑ in early Ep. (exc. Hes. Op. 752), cf. Sol. 24.1: ῐ first in Thgn. 678, Sapph. 2.1 (but ἶσος Ead.91 s.v.l.), B. 5.46 (but ἶσον 1.62, Fr. 2.2), and always in Pi. (exc. in compd. ῑσοδαίμων) and Trag. ( A. Fr. 216 is dub. l.) exc. in compd. ῑσό-θεος (q.v.); dub. in ἰσ-όνειρος. Both quantities are found in later poetry, sts. in same line, ἔχοισαν ἴσον κάτω, ἶσον ἄνωθεν Theoc. 8.19; πρέσβυν ἴσον κούροις, ἶσον ἁδόντα κόραις APl. 16.309.]

data.quote: πρέσβυν ἴσον κούροις, ἶσον ἁδόντα κόραις

children.definition: equipollence, [ τῶν αἰσθήσεων] Epicur. Fr. 36, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.37, S.E. P. 1.8, D.L. 9.74.
possess equal force, [ κινήσεων] κατʼ ἴσον ἀμφοῖν -σθενουσῶν Gal. UP 1.19; of arguments, D.L. 9.73; to be equal in strength, of military forces, Ascl. Tact. 3.2,4.

equal in force or power, πενίαν ἰ. πλούτῳ ποιεῖν Democr. 284; ἀδάμαντος ἰ. ἆορ Opp. H. 2.466; μύες τὴν ῥώμην ἰ. Gal. UP 7.14; evenly balanced, μάχαι Id. 1.364; διαφωνία S.E. P. 1.26; τὸ ἰ. D.L. 9.107. Adv. -νῶς Gal. 9.81.
having two sides equal; κατʼ -ειαν in trine aspect, Ptol. Tetr. 125.
with equal legs, esp. in Geom., having two sides equal, isosceles, τρίγωνον Pl. Ti. 54a, etc.; τὸ ἰ. Arist. APo. 41b14.
that can be divided into two equal parts, even (as 6 = 3 + 3), opp. σκαληνός, odd (as 7 = 4 + 3), Pl. Euthphr. 12d.
containing equal members, Hermog. Inv. 4.3.
having equal tails, of a bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.62 tit.
bean-like; ὄνος ἰ. an insect that rolls itself up like a bean, the wood-louse, S. Fr. 363.
ἢ συστάδην, Suid. s.v. ἀνταγωνιστής.
to be equal in weight, Suid. s.v. ἄγουσαν.
equal in weight, Dsc. 1.44, Orib. Fr. 106, App. Sic. 3; even, σφυγμός [ Gal.] 19.641; gloss on σύσταθμος, ib. 143:—also ἰσο-σταθμής, ές, Ptol. Tetr. 98.
